loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmad is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 29 years old, married and has two children. Ahmad is the only provider in the family.

Ahmad owns a shop for selling tailoring accessories. He established his business in 2011. He has earned good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a youth loan of $2,400 to renovate his shop and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and increase his inventory

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 28 years old, who is married and has a child. Ali is the only provider in the family.

Ali is a carpenter. He has worked in this field since his childhood and in 2011 he established his own business. He has good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Ali is requesting a sum of $3,000 to buy a machine specialized for his work and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a machine specialized for his work and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Hasnin

texts.en:
Hasnin is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and has no children. Hasnin is the only provider in the family.

Hasnin owns a bakery. He established his business in 2008 and now he has two employees. He has good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a loan of $1,500 to buy a generator and a machine specialized for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator and a machine specialized for his work.

loans.name: Hamed

texts.en:
Hamed is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has one child. Hamed is the only provider in the family.

Hamed sells women clothing and cosmetics. He established his business in 2007. He has good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a sum of $2,000 loan to pay the yearly rent of his shop and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the yearly rent of his shop and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 27 years old, who is married and has three children. Omar is the only provider in the family.

Omar has a small shop and specializes in selling fresh chicken. He established his own business in 2005. He has good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Ali is requesting a sum of $2,000 to buy a motor generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator.

loans.name: Mounadel

texts.en:
Mounadel is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has two children. Mounadel is the only provider in the family.

Mounadel owns a blacksmith shop. He specializes in making doors and windows. He established his business in 2005 and now he has two employees. He has good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a loan of $2,400 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassen is from Iraq. He is 40 years old, married and a father of 2 children. Kassem is the only provider in the family.

Kassem owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 1993. He has good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a loan of $2,000 to buy a motor generator for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator for his shop.

loans.name: Sajed

texts.en:
Sajed is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married and is a father of six children. Sajed and one of his children provide for the family.

Sajed owns a spare parts shop. He established his business in 2011. He has good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Sajed is requesting a loan of $2,000 to pay the yearly rent of his shop and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the yearly rent of his shop and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Flordelona

texts.en:
Flordelona is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children from Bohol, Philippines. She and her husband have been engaged in the fishing business for almost 10 years now. This is their source of their income.

Flordelona is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, fishhooks and other items. With this, her husband will be able to improve his daily catch, giving them more fish to sell in the market.

Flordelona hopes to make their fishing business a success and save money for the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, fishhooks and other items

loans.name: Ryad

texts.en:
Ryad is from Iraq. He is 48 years old, married and a father of four children. Ryad is the only provider in the family.

Ryad owns a small shop and specializes in selling electrical supplies. He established his business in 1998. He has good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a loan of $3,000 to pay the yearly rent of his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the yearly rent for his shop.

loans.name: Katani

texts.en:
Katani,70 year old is married. He has 7 children with ages ranging from 28 years to 37 years old. He describes himself to be hard working and ambitious.

He operates a agricultural farm where he sells farm produce. He has been involved in this business for 27 years. His business is located within a productive area and his customers are residents from local  environs. He describes his biggest business challenge to be sometimes drought and floods that hit the area which leads to crops drying. 

He will use the loan Kes 11,100 loan to purchase a water tank that will be used by his nine family members for water storage.

loans.use: to purchase a water harvesting tank.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is from Iraq. He is 48 years old, married and has three children. Salam is the only provider in the family.
 
Salam is a mechanic. He established his business in 2004 and now he has an employee. He has gained good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a loan of $3,000 to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has three children. Ali is the only provider in the family.

Ali has a fruits and vegetables shop. He established his business in 2007. He has gained good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a loan of $1,500 to install an external ceiling for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to install an external ceiling for his shop

loans.name: Rzzak

texts.en:
Rzzak is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and a father of five children. Rzzak is the only provider for the family.

Rzzak owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2008. He gained good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a loan of $1,800 to make a display window for his grocery store. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to make a display window for his grocery store

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 22 years old and single. Ahmed lives with four family members and he is the only provider in the family.
Ahmed has a small shop and he sells men’s clothes like shirts, pants and sweaters. He established his business in 2006. He gained good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a youth loan of $3,000 to renovate his shop and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Glezel

texts.en:
Glezel is a 25-years-old married woman and a mother of two young children from Bohol, Philippines. She and her husband have been engaged in the fishing business for several years now. This is the source of their income.
 
Glezel is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, nylon, lead weights, and other items. With these items, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

Glezel dreams of expanding their fishing business and saving money for the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, nylon, lead weights, and other items.

loans.name: Mwanamwinyi

texts.en:
Mwanamwinyi is a 55 year old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 21 year to 24 years. She describes herself to be determined, obedient and trustworthy woman. She operates a retail business where she  weaves and sells baskets. She has been involved in this business for 30 years. Her business is located within a busy urban town and her primary customers are tourists, local residents and people who visit the urban town regularly. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be unfavourable climatic change especially during rainy season as the baskets get rained on making it hard for her to sell the baskets weaved.  She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy raw materials for basket making. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will create job opportunities for the youth on her business premise.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for basket making.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is from Iraq. He is a youth client, age 27 years old, married and he has two children. Mohammad is the only provider in the family.

Mohammad owns a small shop and specializes in repairing and selling tires. He established his business in 2007 and now he has one employee. He has good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a loan of $3,000 youth to buy equipment specialized for his work and to buy a motor generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his children a good education and better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy equipment specialized for his work and to buy a motor generator.

loans.name: Asaad

texts.en:
Asaad is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 25 years old, married and has one child. Asaad is the only provider in the family.

Asaad has a small shop and he sells men’s clothes like shirts, pants and sweaters. He established his business in 2010 and now he has an employee. He has good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a loan of $3,000 to pay the yearly rent of his shop and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the yearly rent of his shop and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a 52-years-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 25 years. She describes herself to be flexible and respectful woman. 

She operates a farm where she sells beans, maize, onions,and tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for 13 years and employs 3 staff members. Her business is located in a market area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition. She will use the Kes 15,600 loan to to purchase a water tank which will be used by her six family members in storing water for household use and farming.

loans.use: to purchase a water harvesting tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate his shop and to pay the yearly rent of his shop.

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Suha is from Iraq. She is a youth client, 21 years old, and is married with two children. Suha is the only provider in the family.

Suha is a tailor. She works in her owns house. She established her business in 2010. She has good experience in this field and she is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

She is requesting a loan of $1,800 to buy a new sewing machine, an iron and a small generator. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so she will be able to provide her family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, an iron and a small generator.

loans.name: Karrar

texts.en:
Karrar is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 24 years old, and single. Karrar lives with five family members, two of whom are employed.

Karrar has a small shop for selling mobile phones. He established his business in 2010. He has good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a youth loan of $2,000 youth to renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 50-years-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 27 years. She describes herself to be persuasive and innovative. 

She operates a water retail business where she sells water to her community. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a residential area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of water storage facilities . She will use the Kes 11,100 loan to purchase a tank which will be used for storing water to sell to the customers. Her business goal is to drill at least one borehole within 5 years so as to increase the source of clean water to her customers. She hopes that in the future, she will meet her customers' demand for clean water.

loans.use: to purchase a water harvesting container.

loans.name: Taiba

texts.en:
Taiba, 37 years old, is a married woman and a mother of four children. She has been doing the work of stitching for many years. She knows the art of designing dresses and has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Taiba wants to support her family by use of her talent and contribute to the family income. 

She has been in association with Kashf since four years. Currently, she requested a loan of Rs.30000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors, buttons, zippers, etc., to meet the increasing demand. She hopes to have a good experience with this loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her effort in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors, buttons, zippers, etc., to meet the increasing demand.

loans.name: Allah-Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah-Rakhi is a 52-year-old married woman.  She has had a tailoring business for 23 years. She stitches clothes for the people of her community and makes enough through this business. She uses her income to cover the everyday expenditures of her family members. She is a mother of two, both of whom go to school.

She has gradually improved her business and now involves other women to assist her in completing orders on time. To purchase a new sewing machine, she contacted the Kashf Foundation for the second time and applied for a loan of 25000 PKR. She wishes to spend part of the revenue she earnson providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en: Sadia is a 24-year-old married woman. She has been in the clothes trading business for the last 5 months. She is famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. She makes enough to lead a decent life. With the passage of time, her sales have increased along with her income. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family and financial matters. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase clothes so that she can to offer more variety to her customers this winter season. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to offer more variety to her customers for the winter season.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 29-year-old married woman and mother of three children. She has been running a beauty parlor for the past 18 months. In that time, she has become famous on her street for providing the best quality services to her customers. Her husband is a taxi driver, but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members alone.

In order to meet the requirements of her parlor, she contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR. This loan will help her to purchase more makeup kits, lipstick and hair rollers to cater to more customers again and again. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more makeup kits, lipstick and hair rollers for her business.

loans.name: Ameena

texts.en: Ameena has been efficiently running a tailoring business for three years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching and makes enough from this business to contribute to the family income. She is the mother of three children and is responsible for providing them with good quality food, clothing and education. Due to a lack of funds, she is currently unable to meet the orders of her customers on time. Therefore, she contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 25,000 PKR for the second time. She intends to use this loan to buy raw materials, including spools of thread and packs of buttons, zippers and lace. This enables her to meet her customers’ demand consistently, which will ultimately help to generate more cash for her home.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread and packs of buttons, zippers and lace.

loans.name: Basheeran

texts.en:
Basheeran is a 50-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a general store in her community for the last 6 years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and maintains a good client list. Her husband is a rickshaw driver who earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 

She has 6 children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy stocks of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Nosheen

texts.en:
Nosheen has been running a business doing hand-embroidery for the last 6 years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

She is a mother of eight children, three of whom go to school. She wants to grow her business. She requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to complete her customer’s orders on time. She has been in association with Kashf for six years. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village. She would teach embroidery skills, so they can help her expand her business and to also earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to buy thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to complete her customer’s orders on time.

loans.name: Ruksana

texts.en:
Ms Ruksana is a 40-year-old, hardworking, married woman. She is the mother of three children. She is trying to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. For many years, she has been manufacturing waan, a material used in making charpoys (bedsteads of woven webbing or hemp stretched on a wooden frame on four legs, common in Pakistan).

She offers various types of  high-quality waan in different colors. Her husband is a laborer, but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. So she started her business to contribute in the family income. She has improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of  20000 PKRto buy a new waan machine to manufacture high-quality products. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a new waan machine to manufacture high-quality products.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra is a 53-year-old active widow. She has run a canteen in a school for the last eight years. Her son is also working, but his income is not sufficient to meet the everyday expenditures of household.  She makes enough to lead a decent life. She is a loving mother of five children. She is in charge of providing her family with good food, health and education. She has slowly but surely improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase packs of chips, biscuits, juice, and other items. She has been in association with Kashf for two years. She expects more profits and hence better support for her family. She desires to spend part of her income on providing a high-quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase packs of chips, biscuits, juice, and other items for her shop.

loans.name: Meval

texts.en:
Meval is a 54-year-old married woman. She has been running a small cart of food for the last year. She started her business to help out her husband with their family finances. She offers biscuits, cookies and and sweet items. She serves her community well and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

She is the mother of four sons; all are working in a factory. To improve her business, she contacted the Kashf Foundation for the second time and applied for a loan of 25,000 PKR. This loan will help her purchase more packs of biscuits, candies and toffees. She hopes to earn more profit and wishes to spend it to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of biscuits, candies and toffees.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 30-year-old married woman living with her husband and five children. She has two daughters and three sons. Her husband runs food cart in his community. The man shown in the photo is Safia’s husband. Her husband’s income is not enough to meet the basic needs of the family members. In this tough time, Safia has decided to work to contribute in the family's income. She makes mud ovens and sells them in the local market as well as in nearby communities. Her husband also assists her in making them. Both are working together to provide a good standard of living to their children.  

In order to purchase an oven frame, a stock of good quality mud (soil), and buckets of paints, Safia borrowed PKR 35,000 from Kashf. It would help her to increase her earnings through her large sales. Safia has been associated with Kashf for five years. She wishes to spend part of her profits on providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase an oven frame, a stock of good quality mud, and buckets of paints.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Ms Jameela is a 39-year-old married woman. She runs a small general store in her community, offering a variety of items of goods for daily use. She has good communication skills, and a good client list.  Her husband started this business, but he is not in good physical shape to run the store now. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she needs stocks of goods for daily use to consistently meet her customer's demands. 

She has requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy a stock of rice, flour, and grains. She is in her seventh loan cycle, with a good repayment history.  

She hopes increase her income by catering to more customers. She wishes to use part of the profits to renovate her store.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, flour and grains.

loans.name: Tetee

texts.en: Tetee, 39, is married with three children between the ages of 17 and 20 who are in school. They all live in Buchanan, Ground Bassa County, an area that is good at producing fish for the Liberian local market. Tetee is a high school graduate, and has been selling palm oil, rice, okra, pepper, and other items in the local market for the past ten years. She uses a motor bike to get her goods from the bush (village). She really faces problems during the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory (palm oil, rice, okra, pepper, etc) before the rainy season. Her dream is to build a house for her children and boost her business to gain her independence.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of palm oil, rice, okra, pepper, and other items before the rainy season.

loans.name: Ameera

texts.en:
Ameera is a 32-year-old conservative married woman; she has asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Ameera is a housewife looking after her two boys and one girl. She also started a small home business selling detergents, and other cleaning materials.

Now Ameera has applied for this loan to increase the quantity she has of detergents, and to offer more air refresher sprays.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of detergents and air fresheners to resell.

loans.name: Riaz

texts.en:
Riaz is a 47-year-old vigorous, married woman. She is a mother of three children. Riaz has had a business of thread making for the past five years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand for her products is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband works, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. Riaz is the best earning resource in her household. 
 
Riaz wants to grow her business so she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy raw materials such as bundles of wool and cotton threads in different colors to meet the increasing demand for her products. She has been associated with Kashf for two years and has a good repayment history. Riaz shared her dream of running a training center for girls in her village. She would teach them thread-making skills so that they can help her expand her business and also earn money for themselves.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as bundles of wool and cotton threads in different colors to meet the increasing demand for her products.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa, 30, is very hardworking and determined in her business. She is a mother of three children between the ages of 3 and 14, who live with her at home and attend school. They live in Buchanan, a town that is noted mainly for fishing. Hawa's husband is a businessman and he gave her the initial capital to start her business. 

Hawa has been selling palm oil, pepper, salt, onion, rice, tomatoes, vita, and many other items for the past 10 years. She sells for eleven hours a day and she transports her goods by taxi to her business area. Hawa is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support of her business. She is requesting this loan to purchase more rice, pepper, onion, palm oil, and salt for her business. She hopes to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, onion, palm oil, and salt for her business

loans.name: Jenan

texts.en: Jenan, 40, is a single lady who lives with her mother, sister and brother. Jenan is a teacher during the day, and in the evening she has clothing and accessories sales business. She also sells olive oil and cheese, but this business depends on the olive season. Now, Jenan has applied for this loan to buy the new winter clothing collection, which will increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase the new winter clothing collection.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 37-year-old married woman; she is the mother of both sons and daughters. Her husband is a freelance contractor. 

Manal makes, and sells, homemade pickles. She has applied for this loan to buy more food containers, and more vegetables, to increase the quantity of pickles she makes. 

She hopes in the future she can sell to small restaurants, in addition to homes.

loans.use: to buy more food containers, and vegetables, for her pickle-making business.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya is a 20-year-old married lady. Her husband works in fruits and vegetables sales. Aya, on the other hand, works at home selling olive oil. 

She now has applied for this youth loan to increase the quantity she has of olive oil and even refill in smaller bottles for special orders.

loans.use: To buy more olive oil to resell.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 32-year-old married man with no children. 

Ashraf has been working for the last few years in a tailoring business. He specializes in embroidered traditional dresses and outfits. 

Now Asharf has applied for this loan to buy fabric and more embroidery thread.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and embroidery thread.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, 38, is married and lives in Buchanan with her husband and four children, who are between the ages of 6 and 21 and are currently in school. Rose completed her high school education. She is hard working and has been managing her business for the past five years. 

Rose sells mineral water in her community, at wholesale and retail prices. One difficulty she faces is low sales during the rainy season. Rose sells from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. She makes a profit when she sells, especially during the dry season. She learned to sell from her mother. She transports her goods to her business area by commercial vehicle. Rose thanks the lenders for their support of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of mineral water to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of mineral water to increase her sales.

loans.name: Shafeea

texts.en: Shafeea is a 59-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two sons and one daughter. Shafeea has spent her last few years selling blankets to neighbors. Recently, she added selling clothes, too, for which there is a higher demand than the blankets. Shafeea decided to increase the quantity of clothes she has and also continue to sell blankets, and so she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth 41, lives at Buchanan, a town that is noted mainly for fishing. She is a mother of five children who are between the ages 6 and 26 and attend school. Ruth stopped her education in the tenth grade but has been determined with her business for the past 15 years.

She sells ladies' blouses, men's trousers, and ladies' underwear. Ruth started with a little amount of 8,000 LD (Liberia dollars) that was given to her by her husband. She learned to sell from her husband since he is a businessman. She sells eleven hours a day and transports her goods by commercial vehicle to her business area. 

She has commended the lenders for their support of her business. They have empowered her to improve her business. She makes a profit when she sells, and she uses the profit to buy more goods to increase her income. She is requesting this loan to purchase more used clothes for the business. Her future plan is to give her children a high level of education.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for the business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Buchanan Ground Bassa County, known for producing fish on the Liberian local market. She is 49 years old, married and has three children between the ages of 23 and 33. All of them live on their own.

For the past year, she has been selling cookies in the local market. She established this business with a small loan from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, flour, sugar, butter and eggs to expand her business. In the future she wants to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, flour, sugar, butter and eggs to expand her business,

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 42, married, and has six children between the ages of 15 to 25. They all live in the capital city (Buchanan) of Ground Bassa County, which is known for producing fish on the Liberian local market.

For the past 19 years, she has been selling palm oil, rice, biscuits, candy, sardines, etc., in the local market. She established this business with a small loan from her mother. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, biscuits, candy, sardines, etc., to expand her business. 

In the near future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, biscuits, candy, sardines, etc., to expand her business.

loans.name: Elham

texts.en:
Elham is a 30-year-old married lady. She is a mother of three children. 

Elham is a public sector employee, and she also has a dairy and animal sales business. 

Her previous loan was used in buying some equipment and tools for making cheese. Now she is applying for this youth loan to increase the number of goats and sheep she has in order to increase the milk productivity and therefore increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy more goats and sheep for her dairy.

loans.name: Bindu

texts.en:
Bindu is 30 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of  2 and 12 years old. They all live in Buchanan Ground Bassa County, which is known for producing fish on the Liberian local market.

She said she is good at managing her home and business. She has been running a cook shop (restaurant) for the past three years in the local market. She learned this way of selling from her mother.

She is requesting a loan to purchase bitter ball, oil, pepper, rice, dry bush meat and fish for her cook shop (restaurant). She likes her business because her daily sales are high. Her plan is to build a standard restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase bitter ball, oil, pepper, rice, dry bush meat and fish for her cook shop (restaurant).

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en: Haneen is a 22-year-old single lady, living with her five siblings and her parents. She is a university student majoring in Finance. Haneen has applied for this loan so that she can pay for her upcoming semester fees. After graduation, she wants to find a job to apply what she has studied and to improve her skills in general.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a 49-year-old married woman. She has one son and one daughter. Iman works at a private university and recently earned her MA degree in Law. She has applied for this education loan to pay for her registration at the University for a Ph.D. in Law so that she can move forward with her dream and step closer to opening her own law consultancy office.

loans.use: to pay for her Ph.D. registration

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama is 46 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 15 and 28. They all live in Buchanan Ground Bassa County, which is known for producing fish on the Liberian local market.

All her life she has not been to school, but she said she is good at managing a business, and she has been involved in selling used clothes in the local market. She learned this way of selling from her friends.

She is requesting a loan to purchase use clothes for her business. She likes her business because it helps her to save money.

Her plans are to build her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase use clothes for her business.

loans.name: Salem

texts.en: Salem is a 42-year-old married man. He is a father of five daughters and two sons. Salem has two food stores - a medium sized one close to a bus station in the south, and a small one in his village that can serve the families there. Now Salem has applied for this loan to purchase some missing goods for both his stores.

loans.use: to purchase some missing goods for his stores

loans.name: Intisar

texts.en: Intisar is a 31-year-old single lady. She has three single brothers and a married one. Intisar is now in her second year in the university. She has applied for this loan so she can pay for her upcoming semester fees in hopes that after graduation she can work in the banking field.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Sylevester

texts.en: Sylvester is a 43-year-old married man with six children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is to sell cattle and with the income he has earned over the years from this business he has built rental houses to generate additional income. High transportation costs and diseases hinder his business. His vision for the future is to diversify his businesses to include farming. Sylvester intends to use this loan to buy cows to resell.

loans.use: to buy cows to resell.

loans.name: Ignacio José

texts.es:
Ignacio de 52 años de edad, es un hombre lleno de historias y hazañas, su vida ha sido una completa aventura en la que en ocasiones ganó y en otras padeció, pero la experiencia ha sido su mejor recompensa. En su municipio se caracteriza por ser un luchador, por aprovechar las oportunidades y por abrirse camino cuando las cosas no marchan como deberían. Es un humilde campesino dedicado desde su juventud a las labores del campo. Desde hace 12 años decidió dedicarse a la comercialización de plátanos en una carreta que diariamente conduce por las calles del municipio de Caucasia, Colombia.
Está lleno de ambiciones y metas; la principal es mejorar la condición de vida de su esposa y su hijo de 11 años de edad, poderle ofrecer una vida digna y una buena educación se han convertido en el mayor reto para él. Por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que comprará mayor cantidad de plátano para incrementar su volumen de ventas y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ignacio, 52, is a man full of stories and events.  His life has been a complete adventure.  Sometimes he won and others he suffered, but experience has been his best reward.  He's known in his town for being a fighter, for taking advantage of opportunities, and for making his own way when things don't go as they should.

He's a modest farmworker dedicated to farm labor since his youth.  When he was 12 years old he decided to make a living selling bananas from a cart he leads through the streets of the town of Caucasia, Colombia, every day.  He's full of ambition and goals, his main one being to improve living conditions for his wife and child, age 11.  Being able to offer his child a decent life and a good education have become his greatest challenge.

This is why he's requesting a loan to buy a large quantity of bananas to increase his sales and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy bananas

loans.name: Dairo De Jesús

texts.es: Darío de 59 años de edad se ha caracterizado por sobresalir ante las situaciones adversas a las que lo ha expuesto la vida. Tras haberse quedado sin empleo y con dos hijos que sostener decidió buscar una fuente de empleo que le permitiera salir adelante y generar los ingresos necesarios para sostener su hogar. Instaló estanterías en un espacio de su vivienda y montó su puesto de legumbres y frutas para comercializar en su sector. Esta actividad le ha dado la oportunidad de brindarle a sus hijos educación y una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Su mayor reto es tener la capacidad de ampliar su oferta de productos, porque asegura que es la única forma de aumentar sus ganancias. Por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que comprará canastas para mejoras locativas y productos para la venta. Su mayor sueño es poder ver a su familia en mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en: 59-year-old Dairo is noted for having successfully overcome any adverse situations he has faced in life.  After finding himself unemployed, with two children to support, he decided to look for a source of work which would allow him to make progress in life and make the income he needed to support his household.  He installed some shelving units in a space in his home and set up his own neighborhood fruit and veg store.  This business has allowed him to provide his children with an education and his family with a better quality of life.  Dairo's biggest challenge is expanding his product offerings.  He believes this to be the only way to increase his profits.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy baskets, to make some structural improvements and to buy more products to sell.  His biggest dream is to have his family enjoy greater financial security.

loans.use: to buy baskets, to make some structural improvements

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 4 enfants, les sept femmes du groupe Benkadi habitent toutes dans la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités professionnelles.  
Elles  font de la vente des habits, du riz, de bois de chauffe, de tissus, des  plastiques et des condiments. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 6ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Elizabeth, debout à l’extrême droite, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 15 pièces de pagne wax. Elle s’approvisionne sur place  à Sikasso, auprès des grossistes et effectue ses ventes  à domicile, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Madame Elizabeth compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de  30.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer
texts.en:
The seven women who belong to the Benkadi group are all married and live in traditional families.  Their average age is 40 and each women has, on average, 4 children.  They all live in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali) and know each other through family, neighborhood and business ties.  They sell clothing, rice, charcoal, fabric, plastic goods and condiments.

With the aim of increasing their working capital, the members of this group joined Soro Yiriwaso and they are currently taking out their 6th group loan.  Elizabeth, who is standing on the far right of the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 15 pieces of wax pagnes (traditional cloth).  She stocks up at wholesalers in Sikasso and makes her sales from home to a customer base made up of both men and women.  Elizabeth hopes to make a monthly profit of 30,000 francs.  She will re-invest this money in her business and also cover some household expenses.

loans.use: to buy wax pagnes

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 44 years old, married, and has eight children between the  ages of  7 and 19 years old. They all live in Buchanan Ground Bassa County, which is known for producing fish on the Liberian local market. She stopped her education at first grade, but she is good at managing her home and business. 

For the past 15 years, she has been running a restaurant where she sells delicious Liberian food. She learned this way of selling from her mother. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil, bitter ball, pepper, dry fish and dry bush meat for her business. She likes her business because she has more customers and her daily savings are high. 

Her plans are to build her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, bitter ball, pepper, dry fish and dry bush meat for her business.

loans.name: Israa

texts.en:
Israa, a 19-year-old lady, is married to Mohammad, who is serving in the military. 

Her business has improved a lot since she started. The number of her customers has even increased, especially after she started working in a kindergarten, which opened another door of customers for her clothing business. 

Now Israa has applied for another youth loan to bring in a new collection of traditional clothes that reflect not only Jordan's clothing fashion, but also that of the Arab Gulf Area.

loans.use: to bring in a new collection of traditional clothes.

loans.name: David Andrés

texts.es: David Andrés tiene 32 años de edad y su mayor anhelo es poder realizar una carrera universitaria con el fin de tener mejores oportunidades en el mundo laboral. Para cumplir su proyecto, este joven se dedica a elaborar joyería, oficio que aprendió en un instituto y el cual le ha permitido ahorrar para comenzar a estudiar el próximo año. Se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de un taladro y materiales para la fabricación de sus artículos. David espera poder incrementar sus ventas para generar mayores ingresos y poder sostener sus estudios. Su mayor reto ha sido conseguir clientes, ya que muchos son muy reacios a comprar artesanías, pero expresa que eso ha sido un gran aprendizaje porque le permite desarrollar su potencial como vendedor, asegura que se quiere especializar en administración de empresas porque su sueño es montar su negocio en grande.
texts.en:
David Andrés is 32 years old and his greatest desire is to be able to achieve a university education in order to have better opportunities in the working world.  In order to carry out his plan, this young man dedicates himself to manufacturing jewelry, a trade that he learned in an institute and which has allowed him to save to begin studying next year.  

He is requesting a loan in order to purchase a drill and equipment for the manufacture of his items.  David hopes to be able to increase his sales to generate higher income and to be able to sustain his studies.  His biggest challenge has been obtaining customers since many are very reluctant to buy handicrafts but he states that it has been a great learning experience because it allows him to develop his potential as a seller.  He maintains that he wants to specialize in business administration because his dream is to set up his business on a larger scale.

loans.use: to purchase a drill and equipment for the manufacture of jewelry.

loans.name: Lemegio

texts.en:
Lemegio, age 35, sells produce (specifically maize) to earn a living. He is a hard-working man and has four children. The family lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. The primary hindrance to his business is price fluctuation, and he earns additional income from operating a motorcycle transportation business.

Like all good fathers, he desires to educate his children up to the University level. To this end, he hopes eventually to set up sustainable, income-generating activities like rentals. Lemegio's dream is to own a food store and to buy another motorcycle.

Lemegio intends to use his loan funds to buy maize to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize to offer for sale

loans.name: Ernestina Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ernestina, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo porque considera que son muy productivos para invertir en el negocio, son una buena oportunidad para crecer, ella comprara concentrado para dos cerdos que tiene actualmente, ya que se aproxima el verano y es más difícil tener el negocio. 
Con el préstamo anterior considera que le ayudo a mejorar las ganancias en el negocio, su familia tiene una mejor condición, han contado con la alimentación necesaria, debido a la inversión del préstamo, ya que produjo ganancias.
texts.en:
Ernestina has decided to take out a new loan because she believes these loans to be very good for investing in her business.  They represent a good opportunity to grow her business.

Ernestina will buy concentrated feed for two pigs that she currently owns as summer is approaching and the business is more difficult then.  Her previous loan helped her to improve her profits.  Her family are living better now and have received the food they need, thanks to the loan which made her a profit.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed

loans.name: Vanessa Raquel

texts.es:
Vanessa, tiene 26 años de edad, vive con su esposo de 35 años, tienen dos hijos los cuales tiene 5 y 7 años de edad, están en la escuela, Vanessa se dedica a la venta de atol y tamales, tiene dos años de estar en el negocio, lo aprendió de su madre.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales como el maíz, leña, harina, pollo, entre otras cosas que son necesarias para realizar la venta de los tamales, esta compra le ayudara a incrementar sus inventarios y mejorar los ingresos.
La aspiración de Vanessa es mejorar el negocio, ofrece una mejor calidad de vida a su familia  a través de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Vanessa is 26 years old. She lives with her husband, age 35. They have two children who are 5 and 7 years old and who are in school. Vanessa works selling atol [a corn-based drink] and tamales. She has been in this business for two years, and she learned it from her mother. 

Currently, she is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as corn, firewood, flour and chicken, among other things that are necessary for the tamales she sells. This purchase will help her increase her inventory and improve her income. 

Vanessa's aspiration is to improve her business and offer a better quality of life to her family through her work.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as corn, firewood, flour and chicken.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis Fernando de 22 años de edad es un joven campesino, emprendedor y con muchas ideas que quiere convertir en grandes proyectos de vida. El y su familia residen en una vereda del municipio de Argelia, Colombia. Se dedica principalmente a la siembra de cultivos de café, fríjol y aguacate. Labora todos los días de 5 de la mañana a 4 de la tarde en compañía de sus hermanos. Después de terminar su faena se dirige a estudiar su secundaria en una escuela de la vereda. Sueña con ser un gran administrador, porque su mayor meta es poder convertir la finca familiar en una gran empresa. 

En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de abono e insumos agropecuarios para sus cultivos, lo que le permitirá sacar productos de calidad y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Luis Fernando is a resourceful young farmer aged 22 with many ideas he wants to turn into big life projects. He lives with his family in a sector of the town of Argelia, Colombia. He mainly engages in planting coffee, beans and avocados. He every day he works with his brothers from 5 am to 4 pm, and once he has completed his tasks he reaches one of the schools of his area to attend secondary education classes. He dreams of becoming a good administrator, as his biggest wish is to transform the farm of his family in a big company.

He is currently requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of manure and farming supplies for his crops. This will grant him first quality products thorough which he will increase his earnings.

loans.use: To buy manure and farming supplies for his coffee, beans and avocados crops.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel, age 30, trades in produce to earn a living. To supplement his income, he also has a dairy farm. He and his wife live in Kamwenge, Uganda.

He has earned a good reputation and is highly recommended by his customers. They buy from him regularly, since it is known that he supplies good products. His main business challenge is high transportation costs. He dreams of eventually owning a food store in town.

Emmanuel intends to use the loan funds to buy rice to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy rice to offer for sale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, age 39, operates a retail shop. She lives with her husband and their one child in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

After realizing that her husband's income alone could not support the family needs, she sought credit facilities to start up her shop. Like most traders, she faces the challenges of price fluctuation and high license fees. Her goals are to own a wholesale shop, pay her child's school fees, and diversify her business to include farming.

Agnes intends to use the loan funds to buy sugar, soap, and rice to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, and rice to offer for sale

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo, solicita un nuevo préstamo para tener más capital para poder iniciar el trabajo en la recolección de cosecha de maíz, pagando de los fondos préstamos la mano de obra que le permita procesar la cosecha para tenerla en su hogar.
Él considera que el préstamo le ha ayudado para comprarse los insumos, realizando su trabajo en la siembra de maíz, además comenta que en su familia la alimentación no ha faltado, teniendo una condición adecuada.
texts.en:
Gerardo is requesting another loan to have more capital to be able to start the corn harvest, using the loan funds to pay for the labor that allows him to process the corn and have it for his household.

He considers the loan to have helped him buy his supplies to do his job growing corn.  He also comments that his family has suitable conditions and has not lacked food.

loans.use: to pay for labor for the harvest

loans.name: Isaya

texts.en:
Isaya, age 28, grows tea to earn an income. He is a hard-working man with one child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. With the profits earned from his tea plantation, he has been able to pay school fees for his child and has built rentals. His primary business challenges are price fluctuation and prolonged drought that affects the yields.

He dreams of educating his child up to the University level, and he hopes eventually to buy more land to expand his business.

Isaya intends to use his loan funds to plant more tea.

loans.use: to plant more tea

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Luz Mery de 54 años de edad laboró en una empresa de confecciones hace más de 20 años, Comenzó aplanchando pero su interés la llevó más allá, por lo cual le pidió a una compañera que le enseñara como se manejaban las máquinas, desde ese momento empezó a laborar como operaria y posteriormente se retiró  para montar su propio taller. Aunque su vida no ha sido color de rosa Luz Mery ha sabido salir adelante con su hijo, después de sufrir el abandono de su esposo. 

Llena de sueños y proyectos, decidió abrirse camino y buscar clientes que le proporcionen mayores ingresos para sostener su hogar.  En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de una máquina botonadora, con el fin ofrecer producción de mejora calidad lo que se verá reflejado en su rentabilidad.
texts.en:
Luz Mery is 54 years old. She worked for a business making clothing more than 20 years ago. She started by ironing, but her interest took her further, so she asked a colleague to teach her how to use the machines. From that time she started to work as an operator, and later she retired in order to set up her own workshop. Although her life has not been a bed of roses, Luz Mery has figured out how to get ahead with her son, after suffering abandonment by her husband. 

Full of dreams and products, she decided to set out on her own path and look for customers who would provide her with a better income to sustain her household. Currently, she is requesting a loan to buy a button sewing machine, with the goal of offering higher quality production, which will be reflected in her profitability.

loans.use: To buy a button sewing machine.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es casada y tiene dos hijos que esta en etapa escolar, vive en una casa en anticrético la cual se encuentra en Duplex, ocupando un pequeño garzonier, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona  Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente trabaja como secretaria, el esposo actualmente se encuentra sin trabajo, ella trabaja ocho horas al día ya que es la única que cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.

El crédito lo requiere para las inscripciones de sus hijos en los cursos de verano.
El sueño de Sandra  es ver a sus hijos bien capacitados y preparados para un futuro.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la tercera con KIVA.
texts.en:
Sandra is married and has two school age children.  She lives in a house under the “anticrético” mode [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you].  The house is a duplex, and they occupy a small studio apartment.  It is located in the Sopacachi area of the city of La Paz.

She currently works as a secretary, and her husband does not now have a job.  She works eight hours a day.  She does this because it is the only way to cover the family’s expenses for food, education, and basic services.

She needs the loan to pay for her children's for summer classes.  Sandra’s dream is to see her children well trained and prepared for the future.

This is her third request for a loan from IMPRO and the third from Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for her children's for summer classes.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 43 years old and married. She has four children between 16 and 24 years old. Hawa lives in Buchanan, the capital city of Ground Bassa County, which is good at producing fish on the Liberian local market. 

Hawa runs a shop where she sells blouses, earrings, trousers, body powder and spray in her community. She enjoys her business because it makes her busy. 

Hawa is requesting a loan to buy more blouses, earrings, trousers, body powder and spray for her business. She hopes to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more blouses, earrings, trousers, body powder and spray for her business.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony, age 50, earns a living by supplying tents, chairs, and musical instruments for functions. He and his wife have two children and live in Fort Portal, Uganda. With the profits from his business, he has been able to build rental houses. He tells us that his primary business challenge is irresponsible customers who break his chairs and mishandle the tents, leading to losses.

His business plan is eventually to own an events company.

Anthony intends to use the loan to buy plastic chairs.

loans.use: to buy plastic chairs

loans.name: Duván

texts.es:
Duvan es un joven de 26 años de edad, que anda en búsqueda de mejores oportunidades en la vida. Debido a la falta de recursos, su familia no pudo ofrecerle la oportunidad seguir estudiando, por lo cual el decidió convertirse en microempresario para sostener su universidad. Desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta de ropa a domicilio, sus principales clientes son las personas de su barrio y los estudiantes de la universidad en donde estudia. 

Distribuye su tiempo entre la Vida universitaria y las calles del municipio de Sonsón, Colombia, las cuales recorre tres veces a la semana en búsqueda de nuevos clientes. Su mayor sueño es poder terminar su carrera y graduarse como un gran profesional, para hacerse cargo de su madre y sus hermanos. Con el fin de generar mayores ingresos se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de surtido- jeans, camisetas, ropa interior- para la temporada de fin de año y el regreso a clases, que es donde se incrementan las ventas.
texts.en:
Duván, 26, is a young man who's looking for better opportunities in life.  His family didn't have the resources to be able to give him the opportunity to continue studying, so he decided to become a small businessman to pay for the university.  For two years he has made a living selling clothing by home delivery.  His main customers are people from the neighborhood and students at the university where he studies.

He divides his time between his university life and the streets of the town of Sonsón, Colombia, which he covers three times a week looking for new customers.  His biggest dream is to be able to finish his program and graduate to be a great professional so he can take responsibility for his mother and siblings.

With the goal of generating greater income, he's requesting a loan to buy stock--jeans, t-shirts, and underwear--for the end-of-year and back-to-school seasons, which is when his sales increase.

loans.use: to buy jeans, t-shirts, and underwear

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Ms Khalida is a 48-year-old married woman, and the mother of six. She has been running a fabric business for many years; she is well-known for selling good quality fabric in her community, and most of her neighbors are clients. She is making enough to lead a decent life. Her husband is employed in a factory, but his income alone is insufficient to bear the daily expenditures of his family members.

Ms Khalida is significantly contributing to the family income to support the needs of her family members. Her customer base is diverse and varied. She is much in demand, and highly appreciated by her customers. 

Due to low cash on hand, she is facing difficulties in fulfilling the demands of her customers. Therefore, she has requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 in order to buy a wide variety/quantity of winter season fabrics to add to her existing inventory. 

She has been involved with Kashf Foundation for two years. She expects to boost in her net income through large sales.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety/quantity of winter season fabrics to add to the inventory in her fabric store.

loans.name: Tetee

texts.en:
Tetee, age 29, sells imported ladies' blouses, sprays, hand creams, body creams, and makeup to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for the past 11 years. She started in her business first by selling for her mother, who later give her the initial capital to start her own venture. She is proud of her business because she is able to contribute toward supporting her family's needs.

Tetee has three children between the ages of two and six years old. The family lives in Buchanan, a town that is noted for fishing. The children live at home under her care and attend school. Tetee herself had to stop her education in the sixth grade. 

She sells her products 10 hours a day, and she tends to make consistent profits because she sells quality blouses and cosmetics. 
 
She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more blouses and cosmetics to offer for sale through her business. Her dream for the future is to buy land and build a decent house for the family.

She thanks Kiva lenders for empowering her in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more blouses and cosmetics to offer for sale through her business

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 49 years old and stopped her education at fifth grade. She is married and has five children between the ages of 18 and 32 years old. Only one of her children is in school. Her husband is a driver. They all live in Buchanan in Ground Bassa County, which is good at producing fish on the Liberian local market.

Martha has been selling children’s underclothes, slippers, fabric, etc. in the local market. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She requested an 18,000 LRD loan to buy children’s underclothes, slippers, fabric, etc. to expand her business.

She likes her business because it helps her to attend to her family, and she hopes to have a new home.

loans.use: to buy children's underclothes, slippers, fabric, etc. to expand her business.

loans.name: Kyeganywa Farmers' Group

texts.en:
Taddeo, age 38, is a very hard-working vegetable farmer who also operates a dairy farm. He has two children and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a member of the above-named group, wherein each member guarantees the other to access loans. He tells us that his primary hardship is unpredictable weather changes, which limit his profits.

Taddeo's goal is to ensure the eventual higher education of his children. 

He intends to use his loan funds to buy cows.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Ibonde Tweyimukye Group

texts.en:
Christopher, age 35, trades in produce and raises goats. With his income, he has also been able to start a retail shop. He is a member of the above-mentioned group where each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

Christopher is a very hard-working man and lives with his family in Fort Portal, Uganda. His profits allow him to pay the school fees for his children. He names price fluctuation and inflation as his primary business challenges.

His main business plan is eventually to own a wholesale shop.

Christopher intends to use the loan facility to buy sugar and soap to sell in his retail shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap to sell in his retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha lives in Buchanan in Ground Bassa County, which is good at producing fish on the Liberian local market. Martha is 42 years old, married, and has two children, aged 12 and 25, who live at home.

For the past ten years, Martha has been selling lappa (fabric), blouses, and slippers in the local market. She established this business with a small loan from her mother. Martha is requesting a loan to purchase more lappa (fabric), blouses, and slippers to expand her business. 

In the future, she wants to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more lappa (fabric), blouses, and slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizers for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Mukonomura Womens' Gp Group

texts.en: Yusta is a 32-year-old married woman with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her personal goals include educating her children, building a permanent house and buying a car. She is a farmer and has been farming for the last six years. She has hardships of price fluctuations, inflation, customers not paying on time and seasonal weather variations. Her vision is to expand her business to new markets and hire employees to help expand her business. Yusta intends to use the loan to pay workers who are putting in soil and water conservation trenches on her farm.

loans.use: to pay workers who are putting in soil and water conservation trenches on her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel de cuarenta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia; él se dedica al cultivo de jocote, maíz, y sorgo, ya tiene varios años de dedicarse a la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas y siempre tener calidad en su trabajo, el terreno donde cultiva es fértil y apto para la siembra, está cercano a la localidad donde vive y comercia en todas las zonas aledañas, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable; Samuel es un hombre dedicado a su labor siempre dispuesto a superarse, sabe que con todo su esfuerzo y entrega logrará el éxito que tanto desea, en la cosecha pasada tuvo muchas perdidas y quiere recuperarse e invertir por eso le solicita a  INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de jocote, maíz, sorgo, fertilizante, herramienta. Samuel tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, se siento totalmente agradecido con la ayuda por lo que se compromete a cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez le dará a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Samuel is 46 years old and lives with his wife and children in a home of their own.  He raises jocote, corn and sorghum.  He’s been doing this for many years and has lots of experience which allows him to have good quality harvests.  The land he farms on is fertile and good for crops.  It’s near his home and he sells everything in the surrounding zones, where he has many customers who prefer to buy from him because he always has what they need, at good prices, and with unequalled service.

Samuel is a man dedicated to his work; always prepared to succeed.  He knows that he will be as successful as he wants to be through his hard work.  He had many losses during his previous harvest and wants to recover and invest, so he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy jocote, corn, and sorghum seeds, fertilizer, and tools.  Samuel comes with good pay references and is very responsible.  He is very grateful for the assistance and is committed to making his payments on schedule and at the same time provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Okendakala Group

texts.en:
Wilbroda is pictured on the right with her hand raised amongst her Okendakala Group members.  The 14 of them, 13 women and 1 man, are farmers in the Busia District. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant a ½ acre of maize and sorghum. Wilbroda is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined the One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seeds and fertilizers, access the best input prices and once assured of reliable input delivery, to grow enough food for her family and to use increased profits to send her children to school.

Wilbroda described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one as a One Acre Fund farmer. She plans to spend the money that she earns from her next harvest on sending her children to school, repairing her home, buying livestock and perhaps investing in another business. Wilfrida’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 7 acres of maize and sorghum. 

Lilian dropped from the program after the photo was taken.  She is still pictured above.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie lives in Buchanan, the capital city of Ground Bassa County, which is good at producing fish on the Liberian local market. Annie is 50 years old and married, with seven children between the ages of 19 and 30. Three of them are in school and live at home.

For the past five years, Annie has been selling rice, oil, pepper, biscuits, candy, and sardines in the local market. She enjoys the way her customers respond to her business. She learned this way of selling from her mother.  

Annie is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, biscuits, candy, and sardines for her business. She plans to build a house and educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, biscuits, candy, and sardines for her business.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Mwamini's Group

texts.en:
Mwamini's group is comprised of  two hard-working women. Mwamini  is 16 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past three years, Mwamini  has been working hard to manage her sewing business where she mends and sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Mwamini  has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy materials for mending clothes and will help Mwamini  to generate greater profits and boost the business. Mwamini  hopes that in the future she will be able to add more money to the business. 

Mwamini  is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy materials for mending clothes

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth's Group is comprised of two hardworking women. Elizabeth is 17 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Elizabeth has been working hard to manage her small business selling raw food. 

To help expand her business, Elizabeth has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva Field Partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more raw food such as cassava and sweet potatoes for resale, and will help Elizabeth to generate greater profits and pay for her child's medical bills. Elizabeth hopes that in the future she will be able to own a retail shop. 

Elizabeth is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more raw food such as cassava and sweet potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Veronica's Group

texts.en:
Veronica's group is comprised of 6 hard working women. Veronica is 19 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married  and has one child. For the past 2 years, Veronica has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells raw food such as Irish potatoes. 

To help expand her business, Veronica has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her inventory and buy more raw food for the business and will help Veronica to generate greater profits and start another business. Veronica hopes that in the future she will be able to extend the business. 

Veronica is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of raw food such as Irish potatoes for the business.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth's group is comprised of five hardworking women. Elizabeth is 18 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. For the past three years, Elizabeth has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Elizabeth has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more soft drinks, such as lemonade and passion fruit juice, to sell, and this will help Elizabeth to generate greater profits and pay for her medical expenses. Elizabeth hopes that she will be able to build a house of her own in the future. 

Elizabeth is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, such as lemonade and passion fruit juice, to sell in her business.

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
Catherine's Group is comprised of hardworking women. Catherine is 20 years old and lives in the town of Zirobwe, in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past 6 years, Catherine has been working hard to manage her farm, growing tomatoes and sweet potatoes.

To help expand her business, Catherine has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a generator that will help her set up another video cinema and help Catherine to raise more profits to add to the business. Catherine  hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house.

Catherine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills training.

loans.use: to purchase a generator that will help her set up another video cinema

loans.name: Cira Del Socorro

texts.es:
Cira del Socorro a sus 60 años de edad es conocida en su comunidad como una mujer esforzada por sacar adelante a su familia. Toda su vida ha laborado en diferentes oficios que le han permitido adquirir experiencia para montar su propio negocio. Gracias a los ahorros que logró acumular mientras trabajó como empleada doméstica, pudo materializar su idea de negocio. Empezó vendiendo comidas como vendedora ambulante en las calles de su municipio. Posteriormente adecuó su negocio en un pequeño local que le alquilaron.

Su mayor deseo es poder mejorar su calidad de vida y comprar un local que le permita reducir los costos fijos. Sueña con poder ofrecerles a sus nietos mejores oportunidades de estudio debido a que por falta de recursos las limitaciones para acceder a una buena educación se hace cada vez más notorias. Por el deseo de salir adelante y obtener mejores oportunidades para su familia, Cira se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de productos de la canasta familiar con el fin de aumentar su capacidad de producción para la temporada de fin de año y poder generar mayores ganacias.
texts.en:
