He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city, but now lives and works in Absheron region with his family. Tahir needs 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to make repairs in his car. He has been in this taxi business for 2 years. He need to increase his monthly income to keep his family.

It was his second loan on Kiva. He was very thankful to Kiva and lenders for help him.
texts.en:
Tahir is married and has 4  children. Tahir loves his family and spending time with them.  He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city, but now lives and works in Absheron region with his family. Tahir needs 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to make repairs in his cafe. He has been in this taxi business for 2 years. He need to increase his monthly income to keep his family.

It was his second loan on Kiva. He was very thankful to Kiva and lenders for help him.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   Sabougnouma  est constitué de 5 femmes  mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles adhérent à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur premier  prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments, de céréales, d’habits et des fruits et légumes. 
Mariam, qui est le membre du groupe papier en main, fait l’achat vente de céréales.  Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 3 sacs de 100kg de maïs et 1 sac de 100kg de fonio avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma Group is made up of five married women who average 30 years of age and four children. Most of them live in traditional families in the Massablacoura neighborhood in the city of Bougouni. They met through neighborhood, friendship, and business ties.

To increase their financial means in order to better run their business, these women belong to microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their first loan. This group of women sells spices, cereals, clothing, and fruit and vegetables.

Mariam, who is the group member [pictured] holding some papers, buys and sells cereals. With her loan, she plans to purchase three 100kg sacks of corn and one 100kg sack of fonio from the Bougouni wholesalers. She carries out her sales at the market and at home, at retail prices for cash and credit to a group of customers made up of men and women.

Mariam expects to see an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs, which will be invested in the businesses and [used to] repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase cereals.

loans.name: Monday

texts.en:
Monday is a 33-year-old married man with two children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda.

Monday has been selling eggs for five years and practices farming for additional income. With the income earned, he has been able to pay school fees for his children. Breakages due to insufficient handling equipment pose a great challenge to him, while his dream is to rent out a store in town to act as a distribution center. 

Monday intends to use the loan facility to buy eggs to sell.

loans.use: to buy eggs to sell.

loans.name: Sirasi

texts.en:
Sirasi is a thirty-seven year old married man.  He has seven children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been operating a retail shop for twenty-two years.  He started the business after realizing that farming was seasonal and could not provide for his family's daily needs. His business is affected by high license and rental fees.  Sirasi is requesting a loan to buy sugar, salt, paraffin, and soap to sell.  He hopes to one day own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, paraffin, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert is a 33-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of three children. Two of the children are in school. 

For four years, Herbert has been a health worker in a government hospital. He joined this service in order to help the sick people in his community and to earn income for his family. His dream is to venture into business, despite the challenge of a low salary. 

Herbert intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Selestino

texts.en: Selestino is a 59-year-old, married man with four children, living in Kasese, Uganda. For 14 years, he has been operating a retail shop. He started the business in order to supplement his farming activities, which are seasonal. Stiff competition and high transport costs are his challenges, while his business plan is to expand to new markets. Selestino intends to use the loan to buy soda, sugar, and skin ointments to sell.

loans.use: to buy soda, sugar, and skin ointments to sell.

loans.name: Mangadalena

texts.en: Mangadalena is a 30-year-old, married woman with five children, living in Kasese, Uganda. She sells salt and with the proceeds she has been able to pay school fees for her children. A good mother, Mangadalena desires to educate her children up to the University level and build rental houses to generate more sustainable income. Prolonged rainy season affects the business, while her desire is to diversify her business to include fish sales. Mangadalena intends to use the loan to buy salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt to sell.

loans.name: St Marys Kasanzi Group

texts.en: Sadress is a 50-year-old married woman with eight children and lives in Kasese,Uganda. She has been running a retail shop for 21 years, works seven days a week and 10 hours a day. She began the business to supplement her farming activities which were affected by the current global warming effects. Price fluctuation and inadequate capital hinder her business. She dreams of owning a boutique. Sadress intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell. She is a member of St. Marys Kasanzi Group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Waddah

texts.en:
Waddah is a 24-year-old, single man. He has closed his Internet cafe business because of lack of money and has started working in agriculture, but the income he earns is not enough to cover all his needs. For the past three years, Waddah's family has also been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable business, but also needs more support to cover the family's needs.

Waddah is requesting a USD 2,500 Youth loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to help his family cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and expanding and improving the herd's condition. This will increase sales and improve the family's income. Waddah is very ambitious young man. He is thinking and looking in the near future to create a small lab to produce cheese. Waddah is photographed with the herd.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep.

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es:
Doña Elsa, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, vive en el municipio de las vegas, Santa Bárbara.
Doña Elsa siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, es una persona muy emprendedora lleva varios años de vender mercadería como ropa intima, camisetas, pantalones, calcetas, electrodomésticos, calzado y cosméticos. Sus ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y por pedidos, pues ella tiene sus clientes fijos. Ha decidido solicitar este préstamo que es por 3,500.00 Lempiras para surtir su inventario de más mercadería de ropa, calzado y cosméticos. Espera obtener buenas ventas en esta temporada. Para ella su sueño es dar un buen  ejemplo a sus hijos de cómo mantener el negocio trabajando con créditos.
texts.en:
Elsa, 53, is a single mother of 3 who lives in the municipality of Las Vegas, in the department of Santa Barbara.

Elsa has always worked in retail trade.  She is a very enterprising woman who has been selling merchandise for a number of years.  She sells lingerie, T-shirts, pants, socks, small appliances, shoes, and cosmetics.  She makes her sales from place to place and she also take orders, as she has some regular customers.

Elsa decided to request this loan, for 3,500 Honduran lempiras, in order to stock up with more merchandise in the form of clothing, shoes, and cosmetics.  She hopes to get good sales during this season.  Elsa's dream is to provide a good example to her children of how to use loans to keep a business going.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell, such as: clothing, shoes and cosmetics

loans.name: Taleb

texts.en:
Taleb is a 27-year-old young man, he is married with no children yet, his wife is a school teacher.

Taleb lives with his wife in a small village which is famous for its agricultural products from fruits and vegetables. Taleb has been working in agriculture since he was a child; he loves his work and being loyal to his project. Taleb has a big greenhouse where he plants different types of vegetables in all seasons. He cares a lot about his project and harvests a good crop every time, which makes his project a successful and a profitable one, but also sometimes it needs some support to cover the costs.

Taleb is requesting a youth loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing seedlings and fertilizers.

This will allow Taleb to produce a better crop and thus increase his sales and improve the family's income.

Taleb is photographed inside the greenhouse he has.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Slyvia

texts.en: Sylvia is a 29-year-old hardworking woman living in the town of Masindi, Uganda. She is a nurse and has been in service for four years. She is charged with the responsibility of looking after four of her children since her husband is currently unemployed. Good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to the university level. She also trades in clothes to supplement her meager salary and her dream is to own a modern boutique. Sylvia is requesting credit to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Cruz Donald

texts.es: Cruz Donald es un hombre de 58 años de edad, casado, vive en la  ciudad del Sauce, con sus hijos y familiares, el sauce está ubicado en la zona norte del país, y se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de leche  y sus derivados. Él tiene por actividad económica una librería ubicado en su casa de habitación desde hace 10 años que se desempeña en dicha actividad.  Cruz Donal es un hombre que se caracteriza por ser responsable, trabajador, y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en los créditos anteriores los cuales los ha invertido en su negocio. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su librería para que un futuro cercano le genere mejores ingresos y poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.  La rutina de trabaja de Cruz Donal es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias atendiendo a sus clientes en su puesto de trabajo. Él se encuentra muy agusto con su negocio el cual  hasta la fecha ha sido su medio de vida y de su familia. Cruz Donal agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos  de países pobre para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Cruz Donald is a 58 year old married man. He lives in the city of Sauce with his children and family. Sauce is located in the northern zone of the country, and is characterized by being a zone that produces milk and its derivatives. For a living, he has a bookstore located in his place of residence. He has done this trade for 10 years. Cruz Donald is a man that is characterized by being responsible, hardworking, and has demonstrated his responsibility of payment in prior loans which he has invested in his business. The objective of this credit is to invest in working capital and stock his library for the near future and improve income and be able to satisfy the demand of his customers. Cruz Donald's working schedule is to work some 10 hours daily attending to his customers at his post. He is very comfortable with his business which to date has been his livelihood and his family. Cruz Donal is grateful for the assistance that the Kiva lenders provide to people with limited resources in poor countries to have sources of decent work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to stock his bookstore with the purchase of products like notebooks, pens, white-out, markers, glue, construction paper clips and folders.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
María, tiene 26 años de edad, vive con sus padres, es madre soltera de un niño de 2 años de edad, ella le ayuda a sus padres a trabajar, dedicándose a las labores agrícolas, tiene cuatro años de estar realizando esta actividad junto a su padre, trabaja de 6:00am a 12:00md, de lunes a sábado.
Ella solicita un préstamo para el alquiler de tres manzanas de terreno, con esto ella estará asegurando la siembra para iniciar el trabajo en el próximo año.
El objetivo con el préstamo, es que María tenga un lugar seguro donde sembrar con su padre, ayudando a que siga trabajando con su familia.
texts.en:
María is 26 years old, and she lives with her parents.  She is a single mother, and she has a two year old son.  She helps her parents work by doing agricultural work.  She has been doing this business activity with her father for four years.  She works from 6:00 a.m. until 12:00 noon on Mondays through Saturdays.

She is requesting a loan to rent three ‘manzanas’ [a manzana is a land measurement unit equivalent to 7000 square meters] of land.  With this she will be ensuring the sowing in order to start the work in the coming year.  The objective of the loan is so that Maria has a secure place to plant with her father.  It will help her to continue working with her family.

loans.use: to rent three ‘manzanas’ [a manzana is a land measurement unit equivalent to 7000 square meters] of land.

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es:
María, necesita comprar mercadería, ya que tiene una venta de ropa y quiere aprovechar para la temporada de fin de año, comprando mercadería  para surtirla y llamar la atención de más clientes. La compra será en blusas, faldas, pantalones,  que son de la mercadería mas común.
Con el préstamo anterior considera que tuvo un efecto positivo, permitiéndole utilizar el dinero para mejorar del negocio, con esto le ha permitido seguir trabajando para proveer lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
María needs to buy more merchandise.  She has a business selling clothes, and she wants to take advantage of the end of the year season.  She will do so by purchasing merchandise to stock her business and to get the attention of more customers.  She will buy blouses, skirts, and pants, which are the most typical merchandise. 

She feels that the previous loan had a positive effect.  It did so by allowing her to use the money to improve the business.  This has allowed her to keep working in order to provide her family with what they need.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, and pants.

loans.name: Marion

texts.en: Marion is 25 years old and lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. She sells clothes in the market and has been in this business for two years. She is charged with the responsibility of looking after two children. Her dream is to own a boutique in town despite challenges of inadequate capital and the seasonal nature of the business. Marion intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, and shirts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new collection of clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the farmhands for the harvest.

loans.name: Indiana Del Carmen

texts.es: Indiana Del Carmen,42 años de edad, soltera con tres hijos de 7(2do grado),9(4to grado) y 18(Universidad) años, es propietaria de dos negocio uno de mercadería en general como venta de: ropa, cosméticos, perfumes, calzados, y otros el cual lo realiza de manera ambulante y otro de pulpería, el cual lo tiene en su casa de habitación, negocios que los tiene ubicados en el municipio de Chinandega, donde ha ido creciendo más en su ofertas a sus clientes, este negocio lo tiene desde hace más de 15 años, ella inicia este negocio para poder sustentar a sus hijos menores de edad, además siempre le había gustado el comercio. Indiana día a día ella se pone en pie para iniciar un día más en negocio y así poder ofrecerles a  cada uno de sus clientes una variedad de productos. Ella está solicitando este crédito para invertir más en sus negocios ya que su demanda son mayores que sus ofertas y brindarles una muy buena atención a sus Clientes.
texts.en:
Indiana Del Carmen, age 42, is single and has three children, ages 7 (second grade), 9 (fourth grade), and 18 (University).  She has two businesses.  One of them is selling general merchandise like cosmetics, perfume, footwear, and others in an itinerant manner.  The other is a grocery store, which she has at her house.  

The businesses are located in the Chinandega municipality, where her customer sales have been increasing.  She has had this business for over 15 years.  She started this business in order to be able to support her minor children.  Also, she has always liked business.

Indiana rises day to day in order to start another day in business.  This way she is able to offer each one of her customers a variety of products.

She is requesting this loan to invest more in her businesses.  This is because her demand is greater than her supply.  She wants to provide her customers with good service.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics, and grocery products.

loans.name: Lázaro

texts.es:
La señora Lazaro tiene 60 años de edad, tiene tres hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura este rubro lo aprendió de su padre; quien le enseño desde su niñez. Ella se ha dedicado a trabajar la tierra cultivando maíz  y fríjol desde que estaba muy pequeña a pesar de ser mujer ella desempeñaba el trabajo igual que un hombre; pero hoy debido a su edad ya no puede realizarlo como antes. Así que quienes se encargan de realizarlo son los hijos de ella quienes trabajan muy duro para poder llevar el producto a su casa. 
Ella compra los materiales que necesita en el pueblo mas cercano ubicado a un kilómetro de su casa y lo traslada en un vehiculo que ella alquila.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para cancelar a las personas que le ayudaran a sacar su cosecha y arreglarla hasta poder obtener el grano y ser trasladado a su casa. Así, tendrá un ahorro en su bolsillo porque lo hará en menos tiempo.

La principal necesidad a satisfacer, será recoger la cosecha más rápidamente y así tener un ahorro de tiempo en arreglarla y con más facilidad para el traslado. Su vida mejorara ya que podrá obtener un ahorro al trasladar y arreglar su cosecha con más agilidad.

En un futuro ella espera tener su cosecha, ya en su casa arreglada y engranerada esto le dará una mejor seguridad a sus cosechas y quiere poder seguir trabajando mas la agricultura junto con sus hijos y que ellos aprendan este rubro así como ella.
texts.en:
Lazaro is 60 years old and has three children. She works in agriculture. She learned about this field from her father, who taught her from childhood. She has made a living working the fields, cultivating corn and beans since she was very young. Although she is a woman, she always carried out the same tasks as a man, but today she cannot work like she used to because of her age. Therefore, her children have taken responsibility for the work. They work very hard in order to bring the product home.

She buys the materials she needs in the closest town, a kilometer away from her house, and she uses a rented vehicle to move them. 

She is applying for a loan from Fundación Campo to pay the people who will help her with the harvest and remove the husks so the corn can be taken to her house. In this way, she will have savings in her pocket because the harvest will take less time.

Her principal need is to gather the harvest more quickly and therefore save time processing the corn. It will also be easier to move the product. Her life will improve because she will be able to obtain savings by moving and organizing her harvest smoothly.

In the future, she hopes to have her harvest processed in her home. This will give her greater security in her harvest. She wants to continue working in agriculture alongside her children, so that they can learn about the field like she did.

loans.use: to pay the people who will help her with the corn harvest by husking the corn to be moved to her house.

loans.name: Sodia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Sodia  est constitué de 5 femmes mariées et une célibataire  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles nucléaires dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur deuxième  prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments, de tricotage,  de céréales et de cosmétiques. 
Fatoumata, qui est le membre du groupe papier en main, l’achat vente de condiments.  Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 5 sacs d’oignon, 2 cartons de l’ail, et 1 colis constitué d’aubergines, de chou et feuilles de baobab  avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Sodia group consists of five married women and one single woman. The group members average 31 years of age, with three children. They live in nuclear families in the Massablacoura district of the town of Bougouni.

They know each other as neighbors and friends as well as through their businesses. In order to bolster their financial capacity in order to improve their businesses, they have joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and are now on their second loan. This group sells condiments, knitted wear, cereals and cosmetics. Fatouata, the one holding papers in her hand, buys and resells condiments. She plans to use her loan to buy five bags of onions, two boxes of garlic and one box with eggplant (aubergines), cabbage and baobab leaves from wholesalers in Bougouni. 

She sells at the market and out of her home, retail, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of both men and women.
She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 35,000 West African francs, which will be used to invest in her business and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Jose Nehemias

texts.es:
José, se decidió por nuevo préstamo porque necesita el crédito para fortalecer el trabajo que realiza como albañil y taller de estructuras metálicas, una parte de este crédito será invertido en herramientas sencillas,  otra parte para mejoras a su casa.
El considera que trabajar con los prestamos le ayudado a mejorar, comprando lo necesario para que el negocio funcione bien, él ha logrado establecer su condición en la familia.
texts.en: José decided to request another loan because he needs credit in order to reinforce his work in both construction and metal structures. He will invest part of this loan in simple tools, and part of it in some home improvements. José comments that these loans have helped him to improve his work by helping him to buy what he needs to run his business. He has been able to establish a good role in his family.

loans.use: to buy tools for his metal shop.

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es:
Ricardo, quiere invertir en el negocio, para poder realizar la compra de vitaminas surtida para salir a vender, también comprara surtido de ropa nueva en blusas, camisas, entre otras prendas que son de utilidad para el negocio.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo permitiéndole crecer y tener lo necesario para trabajar, sus condiciones familiares han sido mejor que antes.
texts.en:
Ricardo would like to invest in his business, buying vitamins which he will go out and sell.  He will also buy new clothing such as blouses, shirts and other garments that sell well.

Ricardo's previous loan helped him to grow his business. He was able to have available everything he needed to do his work.  His family's living conditions are better than they were before.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, blouses and shirts

loans.name: Angela Azucena

texts.es: Ángela Azucena de 45 años de edad, del municipio de la Paz Centro lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. La Paz Centro se caracteriza por su comida típica “El quesillo y el tiste” ella tiene por actividad económica la venta una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace 17 años que se dedica a dicha actividad, y consisten en vender productos comestibles como arroz, frijoles, pan, leche, jugos, fosforo, canela, huevos, gaseosas en cantidades pequeñas y por unidad. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería para satisfacer a su clientela y en futuro cercano poder incrementar sus ingresos. La rutina diaria de  Ángela es trabajar unas 15 horas diarias para poder atender a sus clientes desde la 6: am hasta las 9: pm. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería con productos comestibles.  Ángela Azucena agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
45-year-old Ángela Azucena is from the town of La Paz Centro, in the west of the country.  La Paz Centro is known for its traditional food: 'quesillo' (stuffed tortilla) and 'tiste' (a drink made from cacao and corn).

Ángela has a grocery store business in her home which she has run for the past 17 years.  She sells products such as rice, beans, bread, milk, juice, matches, cinnamon, eggs and soda in small quantities.  Her goal for this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her grocery store so that she can satisfy her customers.  In the near future, she would like to be able to increase her income.

Ángela works 15 hours a day, serving her customers from 6.00am to 9.00pm.  She will use this loan to invest in working capital and stock her grocery store.  Ángela Azucena is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders provide to people with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua as it helps them to earn a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her grocery store with products such as rice, beans, bread, milk, juice, matches, cinnamon, eggs and soda

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, quiere un nuevo préstamo para invertir en el negocio, comprara un surtido de medicinas para salir a vender, comprara vitaminas, antibióticos, analgésicos, entre otra variedad que existe.
El considera que el préstamo anterior le permitió crecer y tener la mercadería necesaria para trabajar, su condición en la familia ha mejorado, teniendo mejores ingresos a través de las ventas.
texts.en: Víctor is requesting another loan to invest in his business. He will restock his pharmacy with new medicines to sell. Víctor plans to buy vitamins, antibiotics, painkillers, and other varieties of medicines. He relates that his previous loan helped him to expand his business and buy the merchandise necessary to work. His family's situation has been improving since his profits have increased from his sales.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, antibiotics, and painkillers to sell.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Soutoura  est constitué de 2 femmes mariées, 1 célibataire et d’1 veuve, qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur cinquième prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de poissons, de friperies, de savons (lessives et cosmétique)  et des articles divers. 
Bintou, qui est le membre du groupe papier en main, fait l’achat vente de savons cosmétiques et de savons de lessives.  Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 6 cartons de différents types de savons cosmétiques  avec les grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group Soutoura has four members, two who are married, one single and one widow. Their average age is 40 and they have 6 children. They live primarily in traditional families in the Massablacoura neighborhood in the city of Bougouni. 
They know each other from the neighborhood and as friends in business. In order to strengthen their businesses' working capital, they belong to the mircofinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with which they've taken five loans. They are in the business of selling fish, secondhand clothes, soap (for dishes and as cosmetics) and other products.
Bintou, the member with the paper in her hands, is in the business of selling soaps (for dishes and as cosmetics).  With the loan, she plans to purchase six boxes of various types of cosmetic soaps from wholesalers in Bamako. She sells the products at markets, door-to-door, through retail and on credit to both men and women clients.
She plans to make profits of about 40,000 cfa francs per month, which she will invest back in the business and use to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, vive con su familia, sus padres y hermanos, es soltero no tiene hijos, se dedica a realizar viajes como transportista, comenzó con el apoyo de su papá, realizando viajes en un pick up, ahora cuenta con una moto taxi, con la cual trabaja, no tiene un horario definido. 
Él solicita un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento a la moto taxi, ya que su objetivo es brindar un buen servicio a los clientes, para esto será necesario tener en las mejores condiciones el medio de transporte.
Su aspiración es tener establecido su trabajo, realizando los viajes y contar con clientes, a futuro su objetivo es tener un auto bus.
texts.en:
Miguel is single, has no children, and lives together with his parents and siblings. He makes a living as a taxi driver. He started this work with the support of his father, transporting people in his pick-up truck. Now, he uses a motor taxi and works without a fixed schedule, whenever there is work.

Miguel is requesting this loan in order to do maintenance work on his motor taxi. His biggest goal is to offer his customers good service, so he needs to keep his vehicle comfortable and in good condition. It is Miguel's aspiration to establish himself more in this job, have regular clients, and one day, have his own bus.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his motor taxi.

loans.name: Israel Baltazar

texts.es:
Israel, vive con su familia, su esposa y sus hijos, todos trabajan en la familia, por su parte realiza la agricultura y ganadería, esto lo comenzó desde muy joven, sus padres le enseñaron, trabaja desde su hogar, no tiene un horario establecido.
Él solicita un préstamo porque necesita comprarse abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, ya que realiza la siembra de regadíos, esto le permitirá tener lo necesario para trabajar y realizar la siembra.
El objetivo de Israel es tener el negocio más grande, tener éxitos en sus cosechas, para cubrir las demandas del hogar.
texts.en:
Israel lives with his family (his wife and children).  Everyone in his family works.  For his part, he works in agriculture and in raising livestock.  He has been working in this field since he was very young, when his parents taught him.  He works from his home, and does not have an established schedule.

He is requesting a loan because he needs to buy manure, insecticide, and pesticide.  He has already irrigated the lands.  This purchase will allow him to have what is necessary to work and complete the planting.

Israel's objective is to have a larger business, to have successful harvests, and to cover the demands of his home.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticide, and pesticide.

loans.name: David Orlando

texts.es:
David, tiene la necesidad de invertir en el negocio, por eso solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de una máquina para cortar hierro y otros materiales como lamina, hierro y alambres, estos materiales le ayudaran a realizar mejor su trabajo. 
Él manifiesta que el crédito anterior le ayudo para tener lo necesario en el negocio, contando con los recursos para seguir trabajando, en su familia sus circunstancias económicas han mejorado.
texts.en: David needs to invest in his business, that is why is he requesting a new loan. This will help him improve the work he does by allowing him to buy a machine for cutting iron and other materials, such as sheet metal and wires. David explains that his previous loan helped him to obtain the necessities for his business. Having these resources to continue working, he has been able to improve his family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy a machine for cutting iron, sheet metal, and wires.

loans.name: Georges Yvan

texts.fr: Georges est une homme de 34 ans célibataire, père de 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 9 mois et 6 ans l'un des deux va déjà à l'école. Il detient une boutique dans un coin de la place où il vend des de la provende en sachets depuis 3 ans. Grace à son dynamisme et sa compétence dans ce domaine il s'est fait une clientèle grandissante qu'il n'arrive plusn à satisfaire. Ceci est dü à la petitesse de son capital. Pour cela Il sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d'augmenter son stock de provende. Les bénéfices tirés de ce prêt seront réinvestis en partie dans son activité pour l'agrandir, le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Georges is 34 years old, single and father of two children who are 9 months and 6 years old. The one already attends school. He owns a shop in the main square where he's been selling bags of animal feed for the past three years. His business acumen in the field has led to a growing clientele that is difficult to satisfy because of his limited working capital. This is why he is requesting a loan to be able to increase his inventory of animal feed. The profits will be reinvested into the business and the rest will be used to take care of his family.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of animal feed.

loans.name: Perpetue Blandine

texts.fr: Blandine est un jeune femme de 35 ans, mariée mère  de deux enfants qui vont à l'école. Elle est commerçante et ouvert une boutique dans laquelle elle vend les vêtements dans un marché de la capitale depuis 10 ans. Son activté fonctionne normalement, mais elle est obligé à chaque fois d'aller au déballage tous les samedi pour avoir de quoi exposer dans sa boutique. Ceci est dû à la petitesse de son capital, d'ou l'importance de ce crédit dans son activté en ce moment parce qu'elle lui permettra d'acheter un bon ballot de vêtement pour sa boutique. ceci augmentera ses ventes ainsi que ses bénéfices. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité et le reste l'aidera à subvenir ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa famille.
texts.en: Blandine is a young woman who is 35 years old. She is married with two children who are in school. She has been selling clothes from her shop in the capital's market for the past 10 years. Her business is running well, but every Saturday she has to go to the wholesale market to buy the inventory for her shop. This is because she has very limited working capital. The money from this loan will allow her to purchase a bundle of clothes for resale in her shop, which will in turn increase her sales and profits. She plans to invest a part of the profits back into the business and use the rest to take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Patron De San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “GRUPO SOLIDARIO PATRON DE SAN JERONIMO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Monica Gloria ella es soltera y tiene 20 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas, chompas y casacas, la socia vende en forma independiente llevando a sus amigas o lugares donde veden ropa, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia también estudia la carrera profesional de derecho, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde venda ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa como pantalones, casacas, polos y blusas.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de restaurant, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de artesanías y negocio de servicio de taxi.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal banking group “GRUPO SOLIDARIO PATRON DE SAN JERONIMO”. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

Monica Gloria is a single, 20-year-old woman. She owns her own business selling clothing such as, pants, blouses, sweaters, and dress coats. She works independently, door-to-door, selling mostly to her friends or other clothing shops. She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. while studying law at the same time. Her dream is to own her own clothing shop one day. 

Monica Gloria is requesting this loan to buy clothing to sell. The other members of this group work in restaurants, grocery stores, in stores selling handicrafts, and in taxi services. Maria Gloria is grateful for everyone who has a part in her dream in any way, and she pledges to punctually make all of her repayments.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as pants, dress coats, polo shirts, and blouses.

loans.name: Elissa

texts.fr: Elissa est une  femme de 45 ans, célibatiare mère  de deux enfants de 7 et 12 ans qui vont à l'école. Elle est commerçante et ouvert une boutique dans laquelle elle vend les vêtements dans un marché de la capitale depuis 7 ans. Son activté fonctionne normalement, mais elle est obligé à chaque fois d'aller au déballage tous les samedi pour avoir de quoi exposer dans sa boutique. Ceci est dû à la petitesse de son capital, d'ou l'importance de ce crédit dans son activté en ce moment parce qu'elle lui permettra d'acheter un bon ballot de vêtement pour sa boutique. ceci augmentera ses ventes ainsi que ses bénéfices. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité et le reste l'aidera à subvenir ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa famille.
texts.en: Elissa is 45 years old and a single mother with two children, 7 and 12, who attend school. She has been selling secondhand clothes from a shop in the capital's market for the past 7 years. Her business runs well, but she has to go to the wholesale market every Saturday to purchase the inventory for her shop. This is because she has limited working capital. The money from this loan will allow her to purchase a good bundle of clothes for resale in her shop. This will help her increase sales and profits. She will reinvest part of her profits in the business and use the rest of the money to take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Gottlieb

texts.en:
Gottlieb works for ELEPHANT ENERGY, a Barefoot Power distributor in Namibia.

Gottlieb works for Elephant Energy. Elephant Energy is a Namibian Trust that employs a market-based approach to spreading access to affordable energy technologies in rural areas throughout Namibia. These are technologies that improve the quality of life for people living without electricity, who are forced to rely upon costly, inefficient, and health-hazardous energy sources such as candles, kerosene, and single-use batteries.  Because of the barriers imposed by Namibia’s vast distances and limited transportation network, Elephant Energy’s strategy focuses on a highly decentralized network of village-based energy entrepreneurs who bring both education and products to their communities.

Gottlieb lives in Oshakati, Namibia with his wife and children. He has been an actor in rural development over the past 16 years and is driven by his passion for delivering renewable energy solutions to Namibia’s rural areas. Amazingly, he has worked in rural areas in all 107 constituencies in Namibia, which has brought him a keen understanding of the realities faced by the many thousands of Namibians who live off the electric grid. Gottlieb understands both the social and technical sides of solar energy, is skilled in installing, maintaining and repairing solar home systems, and has a keen awareness of what drives and motivates the adoption of new energy practices by rural families. 

This loan will be used to purchase the inventory needed to expand Elephant Energy’s rural entrepreneur model to six new regions of Namibia that are home to the majority of Namibia’s unelectrified population. This is part of Elephant Energy’s strategy to provide improved energy alternatives to 10,000 homes (or 50,000 individuals) in the year 2013.

Barefoot Power is a valued partner because they provide products that are in high demand by Namibia’s off-grid populations. The products are sturdy and rugged enough to withstand Namibia’s harsh desert environments, affordable enough for even the poorest customers to afford, and their focus on integrating cell-phone charging functions provides a huge value-add to these products at a time when the number of rural Namibians with cell phones is rising at a rapid rate.

loans.use: to buy and sell Barefoot Power's solar lighting products

loans.name: Flor Celina

texts.es:
Flor, tiene 27 años de edad, vive con su esposo tiene una hija de 5 años, ella trabaja la alfarería y su esposo es agricultor, su horario de trabajo es de 8:00am hasta las 4:00pm, se traslada a vender la mercadería al mercado. Aprendió con su madre a trabajar con barro, elaborando ollas, comales.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para elaborar la loza, como barro, leña para cocerlos, mano de obra y transporte, esto le será de mucha ayuda para que con el dinero compre lo necesario y continuar en la elaboración de loza.
Su sueño es tener su propia casa, que su hija crezca sana y mantenerse en el negocio de la loza.
texts.en:
27-year old Flor lives with her husband and 5-year old daughter. She has a pottery shop and her husband works as a farmer. Flor’s hours of work are 8 am to 4 pm when she takes her wares to sell in the market. Her mother taught her to work with clay making pots and griddles (used for cooking tortillas). 

Flor is seeking a loan to buy supplies like clay to make the pots, firewood to fire the clay, additional labour, and transportation. The money will be a great help in her efforts to continue making pottery.

Her dream is to have a house of her own, to have her daughter grow up healthy, and to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy clay, firewood, and hire additional labour

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es:
Ana, está acompañada y tiene tres hijos  de tres, cinco y nueve años de edad, se dedica  a la crianza de cerdos,  para obtener ingresos  y la subsistencia de su familia. Este trabajo lo aprendió  por cuenta propia  y tiene cuatro años de tener crianza de cerdos  en su hogar.
Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo ya que necesita comprar un  cerdo y pulimento y a así fortalecer su negocio, que le mejorara la granja.
Sus sueños son darle una vida mejor  a sus hijos mantenerlos estudiando así también que sus ingresos  aumenten.
texts.en:
Ana has a live-in partner and three children, aged three, five and nine. Her work is raising pigs, to obtain income and support her family. She learned this work on her own, and she has been raising pigs at her home for four years. 

She has made the decision to request a loan since she needs to buy a pig and finishing supplies, and thus strengthen her business by improving her farm. 

Her dreams are to give her children a better life, keeping them in school, and also to see her income increase.

loans.use: to buy a pig and concentrated animal feed.

loans.name: José Alcides

texts.es:
Don José tiene 49 años de edad, es casado y tiene siete hijos de los cuales cinco viven con él. Desde hace 32 años se dedica a la agricultura cultivando maíz, fríjol y café; fue su padre quien le enseño este trabajo. Los insumos agrícolas las adquiere en una ciudad que esta a veinticinco minutos de su casa, el viaje lo realiza en su vehiculo, para llegar hasta su destino debe de bajar unas calles empedradas y cruzar varios desvíos hasta llegar a la carretera para seguir su camino hasta la ciudad. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos camionadas de pulva de café, 30 bolsas de gallinaza (abono orgánico) y pago de mano de obra para hacer los orificios para sembrar la planta de café y para comprar 1500 palas. Con la inversión espera sembrar el café en menos tiempo y con menor costo. Para obtener la cosecha en dos años que es el tiempo que se espera para obtener el café. Su deseo es recibir un buen ingreso con la cosecha y brindar trabajo a sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Don José is 49 years old, married, and has seven children, five of whom live with him. For 32 years he has been a farmer growing maize, beans, and coffee. His father taught him how to work the land. He buys his agricultural supplies in a town located 25 minutes from his house, a journey he makes in his own vehicle. To get to his destination he has to travel along gravel roads and make several detours to get to the highway that leads to the town.

The loan that José is seeking from Fundación Campo will be used to buy two truckloads of coffee, 30 bags of chicken manure (organic fertilizer), to hire workers to dig the holes for the coffee plants, and to buy 1500 stakes. With this investment José expects to plant the coffee is a shorter time and with less cost. He will harvest the coffee in two years, the time it takes for the plants to yield a crop. His hope is that he will earn good money from the harvest and he’ll be able to offer work to his neighbours.

loans.use: to buy coffee, chicken manure, stakes, and to hire labourers

loans.name: José Cirilo

texts.es:
José tiene 29 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene un hijo. Él se dedica a la agricultura a cultivar maíz, fríjol y maicillo, este rubro lo aprendió de su padre; ya que desde muy pequeño empezó a  trabajar de la mano de su padre y hermanos. Cuando, creció decidió emigrar a otro país y ahí permaneció durante 5 años, aprendió a trabajar como albañil rubro que desarrolla de una muy buena manera ya que ha realizado trabajos en la comunidad y es muy recomendado por los propietarios de los trabajos.
 Él compra los materiales que necesita, en el pueblo mas cercano ubicado a unos 5 kilómetros de su casa y como el transporte es escaso tiene que trasladarlo en vehiculo privado lo cual le sale muy caro.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para cancelar a las personas que le ayudaran a sacar su cosecha y arreglarla hasta poder obtener el grano y en su casa.

La principal necesidad a satisfacer, será que podrá recoger la cosecha más rápidamente y así tener un ahorro de tiempo en arreglarla y con mas facilidad para el traslado. Su vida mejorara; ya que el podrá obtener un ahorro al trasladar y arreglar su cosecha con mas agilidad y podrá invertir el tiempo en realizar mas trabajos en su casa.

En un futuro el espera tener su cosecha ya en su casa arreglada y engranerada esto le dará una mejor seguridad a sus cosechas y quiere poder seguir trabajando mas la agricultura y albañilería.
texts.en:
29-year old José has a partner and a son. He earns his living from growing maize, beans, and sorghum. His father taught him how to work the land; as a young boy he worked alongside his father and siblings. When he grew up, he decided to emigrate to another country where he lived for five years. While there he learned to be a very good bricklayer, and he has done work in the community. He is highly recommended by his employers.

José buys the materials he needs in the nearest town, located about five kilometres from his house. As transportation is scarce, he has to travel in a private vehicle which makes the journey very expensive.

The loan he is seeking from Fundación Campo is to pay the people who helped him with the harvest and to store the grain until he can get it to his house. His principal need is to gather the harvest more quickly and thus save time, and to have an easier means of transporting it. His life would then be much improved and he could devote more time to working on his house.

In the future José hopes to have a good harvest and be able to store his crops more safely in a granary in his own home. He wants to continue working as a farmer and as a bricklayer.

loans.use: to pay labourers and to build a granary in his house

loans.name: Milagro Gregoria

texts.es:
Milagro, se le presento la necesidad de invertir mas en su negocio, es por ello que  está solicitando otro préstamo para la compra de  maíz, cal, gas, Manifiesta que el crédito anterior tuvo un impacto muy grande, ya que le ayudo a mejorar sus ingresos  y sus clientes se incrementaron.
Sus condiciones económicas han mejorado ella ha comprado una cocina de gas , con las ganancias y tambien comenta que sus condiciones familiares  son iguales.
texts.en:
Milagro had the need to invest more in her business. That is why she is asking for another loan to buy corn, lime, and natural gas. She says that the previous loan had a big impact, because it helped her improve her income and her clientele grew.  

Her financial conditions have improved and she has bought a gas stove with the profits. She also says that her family circumstances are the same.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime and natural gas.

loans.name: Evelia

texts.es:
Evelia tiene 37años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos (dos mujeres y dos hombres) uno de sus hijos trabaja en el beneficio cafetalero del pueblo y los demás estudian. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, en un puesto ubicado en la acera del centro del pueblo. Antes se dedicaba a trabajar en PROCAFE, luego en UNE en oficios varios durante ocho años. Cuando trabajaba aquí, su esposo cuidaba a sus hijos y hoy con su negocio de tortillas los dos pueden trabajar. Los insumos para elaborar las tortillas, como el maíz, aceite, cal,  bolsas, etc. Los compra cada semana en el pueblo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar maíz, aceite, cal,  bolsas, etc.  Y el resto para cancelar una deuda con otra institución financiera. Así, ella dispondrá de más insumos para elaborar más tortillas ya que se le terminan rápido y no satisface la demanda, con las ganancias que obtenga pretende reparar el vehiculo de su esposo para trasladar los insumos; además desea ampliar su casa y construir un muro perimetral para que no se erosione el suelo.
texts.en:
Evelia is 37 years old. She is married and has four children (two girls and two boys). One of her children works in the town's coffee growers' association and the rest of them are in school. For three years she has worked making and selling tortillas at a locale located on the sidewalk in the center of town. Before she worked at PROCAFE, and then at UNE doing different jobs for eight years. When she worked there, her husband cared for the children and now with her tortilla business both of them can work. Every week she buys the materials to make the tortillas, such as corn, oil, lime, bags, etc., in town.

The loan she is asking Fundación Campo for is to buy corn, oil, lime, bags, etc. The rest is to pay off a debt with another financial institution. That way, she will have more materials to make more tortillas, since she runs out of them quickly and can't keep up with demand. With the profits she gets, she intends on repairing her husband's vehicle to transport the materials. In addition, she wants to add on to her house and build a new outer wall so the soil doesn't erode.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, lime, bags etc. The rest will be to pay off a loan with another financial institution.

loans.name: Wendy Carolina

texts.es:
Wendy, se ha decidido por  otro préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la temporada navideña para tener más ingresos  y mejorar las ventas. El dinero será para la compra de blusas, lociones, faldas, camisas, pantalones, calcetines, con esta inversion estara ofreciendo un nuevo rubro a los clientes.
Manifiesta que el crédito anterior tuvo efectos grandiosos, ya que  mejoro su negocio aumentaron sus ventas  y sus ingresos mejoraron, han cambiado algunas condiciones a través de los ingresos  adquirió electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
Wendy has decided to take out another loan which she will invest ni the Christmas season to have more income and to improve sales. The money will be to buy blouses, lotions, shirts, shirts, pants, and socks. With this investment, she will be offering new products to her customers.

She says that the previous loan has a big effect, since she improved her business and increased her sale and her income. She has been able to change some of her living conditions with the income by acquiring appliances.

loans.use: to buy lotions, blouses, skirts, shirts and pants.

loans.name: María Fabiana

texts.es:
Fabiana de 45 años de edad, se ha dedicado a laborar en confecciones, oficio que aprendió gracias a  la oportunidad que tuvo de acceder a un programa de formación a los 23 años de edad. En la actualidad se dedica a la confección a terceros, por lo cual debe buscar contratos y a su vez emplear a varias personas para cumplir con el objeto del contrato. Su mayor felicidad es poder ofrecerle a otras personas la oportunidad de laborar, especialmente a mujeres cabeza de familia. 

Fabiana sueña con montar una gran empresa, en donde pueda ofrecerles una estabilidad a sus compañeras de trabajo. Tiene claro que para lograrlo necesita de tiempo, esfuerzo y dedicación. Por el momento busca ampliar su capacidad de producción por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que financiará la compra de una máquina plana de dos agujas con la que espera aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y sus empleadas.
texts.en:
Fabiana is 45 years old. Her work is sewing clothing, a trade that she learned thanks to the opportunity that she had to access a training program when she was 23 years old. Now she works in third-party manufacturing, for which she has to seek contracts and in turn employ a number of people to complete the contract. Her greatest joy is being able to offer other people the opportunity to work, especially women who are the heads of their families.

Fabiana dreams of setting up a big business where she can offer stability to her fellow workers. It is clear to her that to she needs time, effort, and dedication to achieve this. For now, she is seeking to increase her production capacity, for which she is applying for a loan with which she will finance the purchase of a flatbed sewing machine with two needles, with which she hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions and those of her employees.

loans.use: to buy a two-needle flatbed sewing machine.

loans.name: Bholi

texts.en:
Bholi is 47 years old and lives in the GhuSukpur-03, Kalaiya, Bara district in the city of Nepal. She is married and has three daughters. 

Bholi runs a small tea shop and has a very good personal reputation within her community, as many like to come and drink tea at her cafe. She has taken a loan of Rs. 30,000 to build tea stall to make the tea and to sell different kinds of fast food and bakery items with the tea. In the future, she hopes that her business will expand into a bigger tea cafe and earn enough for her family and to send her children to further studies.

loans.use: to expand her tea stall business.

loans.name: Bina

texts.en: Bina, 42 years old, lives in Ghusukpur-02  VDC, in the Bara District. She is married to Mr. Vijay and they have two sons. They run a tire and bicycle repair business in the community. They started their repair shop with just 20,000 NPR, which they used to purchase equipment and to rent a room to house the workshop. Bina is requesting a loan of 40,000 NPR to purchase more equipment and inventory for their shop. The couple has been able to save some money and to purchase a small plot of land to build a small home.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment and inventory for their shop

loans.name: María Benilda

texts.es:
Doña María toda su vida se dedicó a cuidar de sus dos hijos y a realizar las labores del hogar hasta que por situaciones difíciles en su familia se vio en la necesidad de trabajar y aportar con los gastos de su casa. Preocupada por el bienestar de sus hijos tomó la determinación de comenzar a vender productos de la canasta familiar en el garaje de su casa. Con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo a logrado sacar su tienda adelante y mejorar la situación económica de su familia. En la actualidad desea poder surtir bien su negocio debido a que los vecinos constantemente le sugieren la venta de nuevos productos, pero por condiciones económicas no ha podido comprarlos. Por esta razón a recurrido a la solicitud de un crédito con el fin de ampliar su oferta. 
Su mayor anhelo es brindarles a sus hijos la posibilidad de acceder a  la educación superior  y formarse como profesionales, motivo que la impulsa a trabajar fuertemente todos los días.
texts.en: Maria devoted all her life to caring for her two children and doing housework until difficult situations arose in her family and she realized that she needed to work and contribute to the household expenses. Concerned about the welfare of her children, she decided to sell staple goods in the garage of her home. With much sacrifice and effort, she has managed to get her shop ahead and improve her family’s financial situation.  Today, she wishes to stock her business well because the neighbors constantly suggest the sale of new products, which she has not been able to purchase due to economic conditions.  For this reason, she has resorted to applying for a loan with the purpose of expanding her offerings.  Her greatest desire is to provide her children with the possibility to access higher education and training to become professionals.  This is her driving reason to work hard every day.

loans.use: to buy staple goods.

loans.name: Imasumac De Amadeo Repeto Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “IMASUMAC DE AMADEO REPETO”; Este banco se ubicado en  la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ricardina ella es separada, tiene 59 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio ,la socia vende lo que son pantalones, casascas, polos, chompas entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades,familiares entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como casacas para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de salchipapas, venta de ropa, carpintería metálica, carpinteria, venta de artesania, docente.
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Imasumac de Amadeo Repeto Communal Bank, located in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

The member, Ricardina, 59, is separated and has four children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling clothing.  She has been in this business for years and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She sells pants, coats, polo shirts, sweaters, and other clothing for her customers who order from her, including friends and relatives.  She's a responsible and hardworking person, this being the way she gets her family ahead.

She's requesting the loan to buy merchandise such as coats for her business.

The other members make a living in "salchipapas" sales [sausage and fried potatoes], clothing sales, metalworking, carpentry, craft sales, and teaching.  The member in the attached photo asked permission to arrive late to the meeting.

The member is grateful to those who share this dream by this means and she's committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy coats

loans.name: María Cielo

texts.es:
“En la vida no todas las cosas se obtienen de la noche a la mañana, algunas requieren de un proceso que cuesta esfuerzo y sacrificio” con estas palabras María Cielo de 40 años de edad y con una hija de 11, nos cuenta como a logrado construir su negocio. Manifiesta que comenzó vendiendo productos por catálogo y que poco a poco fue ahorrando para iniciar con su proyecto de empresa, hasta que materializó su sueño. Hoy se siente afortunada por las bendiciones que Dios le ha regalado y  agradece a la vida por tantas alegrías. Gracias a su trabajo su hija ha tenido la oportunidad de estudiar y de sacar su familia adelante ofreciéndoles una vida digna.

Aunque parte de sus sueños ya son una realidad, María quiere seguir creciendo como empresaria, por lo cual desea ver su negocio más surtido y con unas mejores estanterías, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que le permita llevar a cabo su propósito.
texts.en: “In life, not everything is obtained overnight; some things require a process that costs effort and sacrifice”.  With these words, María Cielo, a 40 year old woman with an 11 year old daughter, tells us how she has managed to build her business.  She said that she began selling products through catalogs and that she was gradually saving to implement her business plan until her dream materialized.  Today, she feels fortunate for the blessings that God has given her and is thankful for life’s many joys.  Thanks to her work, her daughter has had the opportunity to study and she has been able to get her family ahead and offer them a decent life.  Although a part of her dream is already a reality, Maria wishes to continue growing as a businesswoman.  She wants her business to have more stock and better shelves and so she is requesting a loan that will enable her to carry out its purpose.

loans.use: to purchase stock (clothing) and improve shelves.

loans.name: El Calvario Group

texts.es:
El grupo “El Calvario” está conformado por 10 integrantes, todas son mujeres, personas muy trabajadoras. El grupo se reúne en una colina en donde lo mejor que se puede apreciar es le sol por las tardes. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron las integrantes del grupo y lo eligieron ya que donde viven hay una capilla que también se llama El Calvario es donde se celebra la crucifixión de Jesús en Semana Santa.

Doña Elena quien forma parte del grupo "El Calvario" platica que tiene 33 años de edad está casada con el señor Víctor desde hace 9 años juntos han formado una familia con tres niños que se encuentran estudiando, Doña Elena se dedica a realizar paletas de hielo y helados desde hace 8 años Doña Elena las realiza para después venderlas, comenta que inicio con su actividad porque antes de que se casaran Don Víctor ya se dedicaba a la venta de sus paletas y helados, las paletas y helados son preparados desde dos días antes ya que para la elaboración es todo un proceso como moler la fruta, poner en moldes para después ponerlos a congelar y finalmente embolsarlos,  preparar el helado, cuando ya tienen sus helados preparados y paletas colocan todo en su carrito y salen a ofrecer al mercado o en la comunidad donde viven sus helados, Doña Elena comenta "Me gusta mucho salir a vender mis helados y paletas y escuchar a las personas decir que les gusta mis productos esa es la mejor satisfacción que obtengo de mis clientes" Doña Elena está solicitando el crédito a la institución para comprar más material para la realización de sus paletas y helados como palos, colorantes, fruta, leche y leche.
La dificultad que presenta Doña Elena es en la época de frio porque nadie comprar sus productos las personas lo menos que consumen son las cosas frías como las paletas y helados, Aunque esto no la detiene a tener sueños de llegar algún día a tener una nevería mas grande esto le ayudara para que sus hijas tengan algún día una carrera profesional y puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida. Los integrantes del grupo están muy contentos por el crédito otorgado ya que podrán invertirle en sus negocio como Doña Felicitas, Elia y Enriqueta en una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, Cristal herramientas para construcción, Petra, María Guadalupe, Luisa y Margarita en borregos y Doña Alberta en ropa.
texts.en:
The group "El Calvario" (The Calvary) consists of 10 members, all of them women, very hard-working people. The group meets on a hill where the best thing to appreciate is the afternoon sun. The members chose the name of the group, and they chose it because in the area where they live there is a chapel which is also called The Calvary, and it is where they observe the crucifixion of Jesus during Holy Week.

Doña Elena, who is part of the El Calvario group, relates that she is 33 years old. She has been married to Señor Victor for 9 years. Together they have formed a family with three children, who are in school. Doña Elena's work for eight years has been making popsicles and ice cream. She makes them to sell, and she comments that she began her business because before they were married Don Victor was already selling popsicles and ice cream. The popsicles and ice creams are made two days ahead of time, since the preparation involves a process of grinding the fruit, putting it into molds to then set it to freeze, and finally putting it in bags. When they have the ice creams and popsicles ready, they gather them in their cart and go out to offer them in the market or in the community where they live. Doña Elena comments, "I very much like to go out to sell my ice creams and popsicles and hear the people say that they like my products. It is the greatest satisfaction that I obtain from my customers." Doña Elena is applying to the institution for the loan to buy more materials to make her popsicles and ice creams, such as sticks, coloring, fruit, and milk.

The difficulty that Doña Elena faces is in the cold season, because nobody buys her products, since the last things people want to eat are cold things like popsicles and ice cream. However, this does not stop her from having a dream of someday having a bigger freezer. This will help her so that her daughters can some day have a professional career and have a better quality of life.

The members of the group are very happy with the credit offered, since they will be able to invest in their businesses, such as Doña Felicitas, Elia, and Enriqueta in a little grocery store; Cristal in construction tools; Petra, Maria Guadalupe, Luisa, and Margarita in sheep; and Doña Alberta in clothes.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags, fruit, milk, food coloring, etc., to make popsicles and ice cream.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: Annabelle is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a shell crafts business and Avon dealership business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy materials for her shell crafts business. NWTF is re-listing Annabelle's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials such as shells for her crafts business

loans.name: María Sol

texts.es:
Maria Sol de 41 años de edad es una mujer visionaria y emprendedora. Desde niña su mayor sueño fue convertirse en una gran empresaria, creando su propio negocio y manejando su tiempo. Aunque la vida le permitió cumplir su anhelo, tuvo que atravesar un camino que le dio experiencia y madurez para administrar idóneamente su negocio. Laboró por más de 10 años en producción.

En la actualidad ella se encuentra tejiendo su proyecto de negocio, con la ayuda de una vecina y una tía, las cuales laboran diariamente de 8 de la mañana a 7 de la noche en confección a terceros. 
Su gran anhelo es poder tener una línea propia de ropa femenina con marca reconocida. Para lograrlo, necesita de una máquina ojaladora, compra de telas e hilos que le permitan fabricar prendas de calidad. Aunque le sobran motivaciones, no cuenta con el dinero para dicha inversión, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito.
texts.en:
Maria Sol is 41 years old. She is a visionary and entrepreneurial woman. Since her childhood, her greatest dream was to become a great businesswoman, creating her own business and managing her time. Even though life allowed her to accomplish her goal, she had to traverse a route that gave her experience and maturity to appropriately run her business. She has worked for more than 10 years in clothing production.

Now she is putting together her business project with the help of a neighbor and an aunt, who work daily from 8 in the morning until 7 in the evening doing third-party clothing construction.

Her great dream is to be able to have her own line of women's clothing with a recognized trademark. To achieve this, she needs an holemaking machine and to buy fabrics and threads that will allow her to make quality clothing items. Even though she has plenty of motivation, she doesn't have the money for this investment, and for this reason she is applying for a loan.

loans.use: to buy a holemaker, fabrics, and threads.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para comprar verduras, como tomates, chiles, güisquiles, papas, lechugas, aguacates, esto le ayudara para tener más surtido el negocio y poder satisfacer la demanda.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, ya que el crédito le ayudo a incrementar la mercadería  para obtener más ingresos, sus condiciones económicas han mejorado y se mantiene con su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca decided on a new loan to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, chilies, chayotes, potatoes, lettuces and avocados.  This will help her to have a greater assortment in the business and to be able to satisfy demand.

With the previous loan she had a positive effect since the loan helped her to increase merchandise to obtain better income.  Her economic conditions have improved and she supports herself along with her family.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, chilies, chayotes, potatoes, lettuces and avocados.

loans.name: Lorena Patricia

texts.es:
Lorena, se dedica a la venta de pan francés y tambien hot dog, él tiene 30 años de edad, está casado, tienen dos hijos de cinco y siete años de edad, los cuales están estudiando, él se dedica a este negocio trabajando de lunes a sábado, por las tardes desde hace siete años.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de pan francés, para la venta, tambien lo necesario para la venta de hot dog, esto le ayudara para incrementar sus ingresos, contar con lo necesario para su negocio.
La aspiración de Lorena es mantener el negocio, ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor condición y apoyo.
texts.en:
Lorena sells French bread and also hot dogs. She is 30 years old and is married. She has two children, ages 5 and 7, who are in school. She works in this business from Monday to Saturday in the afternoons. She has been doing this for 7 years.

Now she is applying for a loan to purchase French bread to sell. She also needs it for the hot dog sales. This will help her to increase her income, by having everything needed for her business.

Lorena's goal is to maintain her business, to offer her children better living conditions and support.

loans.use: to buy French bread and hot dogs to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cecilia is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.

Cecilia has a trisikad transport business in the Philippines. Cecilia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for her trisikad transport business.

She has been in this business for four years. In the future, Cecilia would like to build and expand her business to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her trisikad

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 53 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Carmelita has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Carmelita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Carmelita would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Yanci Azucena

texts.es:
Yanci, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para la compra de mercadería para la época, comprara bananos, naranjas, zanahorias, güisquil, frescas, que sean de la satisfacción de los clientes, esto le ayudara para surtir con frutas frescas,
Con el préstamo anterior logro realizar la inversión necesaria para dar una mejor  nivel en la venta, está mejorando su situación en el negocio y en su hogar, también comenta que goza de buena salud.
texts.en:
Yanci decided to apply for a new loan to purchase seasonal merchandise. She will buy fresh bananas, oranges, carrots, chayote, and strawberries, which will satisfy her customers. This will help her to stock her business with fresh fruits.

With the past loan she was able to make the needed investment to achieve a better level of sales. She is improving her situation in her business and in her home. She also comments that she is enjoying good health.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oranges, carrots, chayote, and strawberries to sell.

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega Group

texts.es:
Otro de los integrantes de este grupos es Fredy tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres, él desea apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa, así que hace dos años le pidió a su mamá que le enseñara a bordar, ahora el ya tiene sus propios clientes, los productos que son más populares son servilletas, manteles y  fundas para almohadas. “Éste es un buen negocio, apoyo a mis papás y además puedo comprar cosas para mi, por ejemplo, me acabo de comprar una motocicleta gracias a las ganancias de mi negocios”. 

El tambien realiza ventas de volones por las tardes en su moto sale a ofrecerlos por las calles y dice que se venden muy bien. Fredy está solicitando un préstamo para comprar por mayoreo, ya que así consigue un mejor precio y su ganancia es mayor; va a comprar hilos, agujas, fundas, manteles, aros para bordar, y arinas, jamon, salchichas, piña, salsa capsu y salsa picante etc. 

El deseo de Fredy es lograr tener una tienda con vitrinas donde pueda mostrar los bordados que vende, además de vender productos de mercería. 

Los demas integrantes del grupo son:
Sirina venta de antojitos
Juana venta de ropa
Avelina venta de antojitos
Maria venta de mole
Rosalba venta de ropa
Lorena venta de calzado
Irma venta de tacos
Minerva venta de antojitos
Ariana venta de ropa
Veronica accesorios de plata

loans.use: to buy threads, needles, pillow cases, tablecloths, embroidery hoops; and flour, ham, sausages, pineapple, ketchup and hot sauce.

loans.name: Rene Antonio

texts.es:
René,  tiene 35 años de edad, está casado, tiene una hija de un año de edad, èl se dedica a la ganadería, tiene vacas lecheras y ganado de engorde, este negocio lo aprendió con sus padres, tiene 20 años de realizarlo.
El necesita un préstamo, el cual invertirá en la compra de dos novillos para engordarlos, esta compra le incrementara su hato ganadero y los ingresos a futuro.
Su aspiración es fortalecer el negocio y ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
René, 35, is married and has a one year old daughter. He is a cattle rancher. He has dairy cows and cows for fattening. He learned this business from his parents and has been doing it for 20 years.

He needs a loan to buy two young bulls to fatten. This purchase will increase his flock of cattle and his future income. 

His goal is to strengthen his business and offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two young bulls to fatten.

loans.name: William Miguel

texts.es:
Willian es un hombre de 41 años, es soltero, vive en  la ciudad de Pucallpa, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos  y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, William no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta seguir trabajando  y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Cau Cau, el cual es su comida favorita.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Willian tiene un pequeño negocio donde vende refrescos, queques y algunas frutas, como el aguaje, la cual es una fruta típica de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, el cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Willian se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una mesa, recipientes para refrescos y también podrá comprar madera para hacer el mejoramiento de su vivienda, de esta manera William tendrá su hogar y negocio en mejores condiciones, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio local comercial.
texts.en:
William, 41, is single and lives in the city of Pucallpa. He is very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic, and has a great desire to get ahead. Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources and out of a need to start working at a young age, William wasn't able to study business administration like he very much wanted to do.
