In his free time he likes to keep working and sometimes he cooks a delicious Cau Cau [tripe and potato stew], which is his favorite food.

At his own initiative, with a lot of dedication, he has a small business where he sells drinks, cakes and some fruits like aguaje, which is a typical fruit in his city. He works every day from very early in the morning for approximately 8 hours. He thinks it's going well because of his good prices and the friendly treatment that he gives his customers.

William is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to buy a table, containers for sodas and also wood to make improvements to his home. In this way, William will improve the conditions of his home and his business so that he can keep working and making an effort to get ahead and achieve his big dream: to have his own store.

loans.use: to buy a table, containers and wood.

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es:
Jaime, se le presenta la oportunidad para continuar trabajando en el negocio, se comprara por mayoreo queso y crema, los cuales permitirán que su negocio cuente con lácteos frescos para la venta.

El crédito anterior le permitió a Jaime mejorar el negocio, logrando comprar los productos frescos para mantener a la venta, sus circunstancias familiares se mantienen.
texts.en:
Jaime has the opportunity to continue at his business. He will buy cheese and cream in bulk, which will allow him to continue selling fresh dairy products. 

His previous loan allowed Jaime to improve his business, buying fresh dairy products to maintain his sales. His family circumstances are the same.

loans.use: to buy cheese and cream in bulk.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a recycled materials retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more recycled materials to sell.

NWTF is relisting Dioscora's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Maris Stella

texts.en:
Maris Stella is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 26, married and has two children. For 7 years, she has owned and operated a specialized general store where she earns 10,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Maris Stella joined GDMPC. Maris Stella is now requesting a new loan of 24,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items such as candies, Milo (a brand of malted milk), shampoo and soaps. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo and soaps.

loans.name: Gertrudis Patricio

texts.es:
Gertrudis de 52 años de edad,  es originario de la Comarca llamada Cacaos , de las afueras de Teustepe, padre de 6 hijos mayores de edad, actualmente solo uno esta estudiando,  de oficio comerciante, se dedica a  una de las actividades mas comunes de la ciudad de Teustepe como es la siembra  de maíz, frijol y trigo. Inicio su actividad agrícola desde hace 27 años. Gertrudis es quien se encarga de la  tierras y de darles mantenimiento a los potreros, pero no solo se encarga del cuido del las tierras también siembra maíz, frijol y trigo, ordeña sus vaquitas y cría cerdos. El  dice que cuando saca la cosecha la vende en el mismo sector para evitar gasto de transporte y porque es más seguro vender su producto en la misma comunidad. Cuenta con otros ingresos  dinero que le dan sus hijos.

Solicita el crédito para comprar parte de los insumos para la huerta y  comprar animales, el  estima  que este crédito le será de ayuda porque podrá invertir mas en su producción de animales y  aun mas para después venderlos a un mejor precio y también podrá hacerle las reparaciones a las cercas para evitar que las vacas se pasen a la huerta. Sus planes futuros son una vez  que saque la cosecha cancelar el crédito y de las ganancias de la venta de los cerdos comprar unas vaquillas para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Gertrudis is 52 years old and is native of the region called Cacaos, on the outskirts of Teustepe. He is the father of six adult children, only one of them is currently studying. He is businessman by profession, and he is dedicated to one of the most common activities in the Teustepe city such as planting corn, beans and wheat. He started farming 27 years ago.

Gertrudis is in charge of the land and keeps the pastures, but he not only takes care of the land, he also grows corn, beans, and wheat. He also milks his cows and breeds pigs. He says that when he sells out the crops, he sells it in the same area to avoid transportation costs and because it is safer to sell his product within the community. He has other income such as money his children give him.

He is requesting this loan to buy some of the supplies for the garden and to buy animals. He estimates that this credit will be helpful because he will be able to invest more in the production of even more animals and then sell at a better price. He will also be able to repair the fences to keep the cows pass the garden. His future plans are to cancel the credit after the harvest. Also, with the profits of selling the pigs, he wants to buy some cows to obtain higher income.

loans.use: to buy some of the supplies for the garden and to buy animals.

loans.name: Denisa

texts.en:
Denisa is 33 years old and married. Denisa works very hard to provide for her family.

Denisa runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, sugar and other groceries. Denisa has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory items to sell.

In the future Denisa would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory items to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is from Pandahan, SND. She's 48, married, and has seven children. To make a living, Myrna has been running a general store for 10 years and gets a monthly income of 5,000 PHP. Myrna is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to buy more items such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste. Myrna joined GDMPC this year. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy more items such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients and utensils for her food business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for her food business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 57 años de edad, es una mujer alegre, amable y con mucha experiencia en los negocios, es conviviente con Dennis de 55 años quien es pescador, vive en compañía de sus padres, su pareja y sus hijos de 20 y 17 años de edad en su casa propia que logró construir con el apoyo de su conviviente tras muchos años de trabajo.
El negocio que Carmen realiza consiste principalmente en la venta de prendas de vestir usadas, cumple esta labor en las zonas aledañas a los ríos hasta donde viaja de manera frecuente vía fluvial, los pobladores de dichos caseríos le solicitan diversas prendas, ellas consigue la ropa en distintos centros comerciales de la ciudad y luego los vende en cada lugar que visita, realiza ésta labor hace 3 años. Trabaja sola pero viaja en compañía de su conviviente ya que el se dedica a la pesca y aprovecha en vender todo lo que tiene mientras él realiza su faena pesquera. Cuando se encuentra en la ciudad se dedica a la venta de golosinas como galletas, caramelos y otros.
Le gustan ambas actividades que realiza ya que la mantiene ocupada y se decidió por ellas por la necesidad de tener un oficio para contar con un ingreso económico para solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos. Lo que no le agrada, según comenta, es que algunas veces no ha logrado pescar lo suficiente para cubrir los gastos de la pesca, muchas veces debido a la escasez de los peces o a la creciente de los ríos, pero eso no la desanima y continúa hacia delante es por eso que tiene planes de seguir con su negocio.
Este es el crédito número 3 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado está muy comprometida una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo, está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1800), comprará diversos fardos conformados por prendas de vestir, de esta manera espera seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Carmen is 57 years old and is a happy, friendly woman with lots of business experience.  She lives with 55 year old Dennis who is a fisherman, with her parents, and children, ages 20 and 17 in a home that she built with help from her husband and many years of work.

Carmen sells used clothing in the nearby zones around Los Rios, where she travels frequently by river.  People from these areas request various types of clothing from her.  She buys the clothing in different shopping areas in the city and then sells them in each place she visits.  She’s been doing this for three years.  [Carmen] works alone but travels with her husband, since he is a fisherman; she takes advantage of the time to make her sales while he accomplishes his fishing tasks.  When she is back in town she sells snacks such as cookies, candy, and other things.

She likes both businesses because they keep her busy and she started them out of need for having a trade to count on for an income to help pay the household expenses and her children’s education.  What she doesn’t like, she says, is that sometimes there is not enough fish to cover the cost of fishing.  Many times it’s because of the scarcity of fish or the growth of Los Rios, but this does not discourage her and she continues forward.  She plans to continue with her business.

This will be her third loan through MFP and therefore is grateful to those who make this loan possible so that she can continue with her objectives.  She is also very committed to making her payments on time as with the previous loans.  She is very happy to be with the communal bank because all the members are good, friendly, and united.

She will use the (S/. 1,800) to buy bales of clothing and continue working.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic, 37 years old, is a married entrepreneur in San Carlos, Tukuran, with three children. She is earning from her transportation service business. It has been going for almost three years now and she earns PHP 6,000 a month. To improve business, she borrows the amount of PHP 25,000 from GDMPC microcredit, which she just joined recently to obtain accessories and tires. She’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business before long.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia is 45 years old, married and the mother of two children. She lives in Alindahaw, Tukuran, where she has earned a living for the last 12 years by selling home use products. Amalia makes PHP 5,000 a month and is applying for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. Amalia joined GDMPC this year as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
Marcelo es un hombre de 44 años, es soltero, vive en  la ciudad de Pucallpa, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos  y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Marcelo no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Mecánica Automotriz que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta  asistir a su iglesia para escuchar la palabra de Dios  y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Picadillo de Paiche, el cual es su comida favorita.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Marcelo tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de madera, en especial de leña, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, el cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Marcelo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una furgoneta, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder transportar leña;  de esta manera Marcelo desea seguir trabajando para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda adquirir 3 furgonetas para iniciar un negocio de alquiler.
texts.en:
Marcelo is 44-year-old man. He is single and lives in the city of Pucallpa; he is a very cheerful, hardworking, and enthusiastic person, who has a great desire to overcome. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the necessity that he had to work since he was very young, Marcelo couldn’t study for the professional career as a car mechanic that he wanted, but he would have liked very much to do so. In his free time, he likes to attend his church to listen to the word of God, and sometimes, he cooks a delicious Picadillo de Paiche, which is his favorite food. 

Through his own initiative, with much determination and dedication, Marcelo has a small business selling wood, particularly firewood. He works every day from the early hours of the morning, and he can work for approximately 12 hours. He believes that it goes well for him because of his good prices and the kind manner that he offers to his customers. 

Marcelo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they’ve given, he will be able to carry out the purchase of a truck, which he will use a lot to transport firewood. In this way, Marcelo hopes to continue working so that in the near future, he can acquire 3 trucks in order to start a renting business.

loans.use: to purchase a truck.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 30 years old, married and has two children. She raises cows and has been in business for the last seven years. She also grows vegetables to sell. She is very hard working.
 
She hopes to be the main supplier of milk and vegetables in her area. She requires a loan of 84,442.50 KES to buy animal feed and expand her cow shed.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and expand the cow shed

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She's 40, married, and has three children. To make a living, Margarita runs a fruit business, selling a variety of fruit products in the local community. Margarita has been engaged in her business for nine years and earns 16,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Margarita joined GDMPC. Margarita asked for a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fruit to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruit to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Evelyn works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from e-loading (cellphone credits). 

Evelyn  is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase more items like detergent, soap, diapers and other groceries for her general store business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to expand her business and continue to send her kids to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like detergent, soap, diapers and other groceries.

loans.name: Fransisca

texts.en: Fransisca is 37 years old, married and has been blessed with three children. She owns a cafe and a butchery. She has been in business for the last seven years. She was previously employed as a security guard at a firm. Faulu Kenya has helped her expand her business and improve her lifestyle. She hopes to have a big restaurant. She requires a loan of 105,300 KES to buy meat, maize flour, wheat flour and soda.

loans.use: to buy meat, maize flour, wheat flour and soda

loans.name: Hafitha

texts.en:
Hafitha is a 43-year-old married woman. She looks after her own three sons and another three of her husband’s. 

The fact that she does not know how to read or write has limited her options in getting a job, so she started three years ago selling snacks like biscuits and chocolate and potato chips to be able to support her family. Now Hafitha has applied for this loan to bring in more food products other than snacks in hopes that one day she can open a separate small store.

loans.use: to bring in more food products.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. At age 38, she is married and has three children. To make a living, Rebecca owns and operates a business selling a variety of fruit products. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for six years and earns 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. 

In 2008, Rebecca joined GDMPC. Rebecca is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fruits to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits to sell.

loans.name: Salameh

texts.en: Salameh is 29 years old and single. He is a brother to two younger sisters. Salameh is a part of the Jordanian army forces, and he is also studying Finance and Banking at a university. He is now in his fourth year, almost a graduate. He has applied for this education loan to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is 38 years old, married and has two children. He is a farmer and he also raises cows. He has been farming for two years. He is also employed as a driver of a taxi. He is a very determined and hard working man. He describes his business as very productive. He hopes to be a very successful man and to buy more cows. He requires a loan of 47,941.88 KES to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Celnape

texts.en: Celnape, 35 years old, is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and has three children. Celnape operates a general store, selling a variety of food and household products. She has been in business for five years and earns 15,000 PHP a month from her business. Celnape is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. In 2006, Celnape joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

NWTF is listing Elvie's business profile again for a new loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo,groceries etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Nyakaina Women Group

texts.en: Mudak is a 65-year-old married man with 11 children living in Kasese, Uganda. For five years, he has been running a retail shop and he started the business to supplement his coffee trade, which is seasonal. The good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the University and set up sustainable income-generating activities for each of his children. Price fluctuations and high license fees hinder his business. His business plan is to trade in wholesale and directly export coffee to the nearby countries. Mudak intends to use the loan to buy cassava flour, soap, sugar and sweet bananas to sell. He is a member of the group shown above in the photograph where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan. That is why the eighth person appears in the photo even though he didn't apply for a loan .

loans.use: to buy cassava flour, soap, sugar and sweet bananas to sell.

loans.name: Eillen

texts.en:
Eillen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a trisikad transport business in the Philippines.

Eillen requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for her trisikad.

She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Eillen would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her trisikad.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa is a 39-year-old mother of two boys and one girl. Sanaa is a hair stylist and she also has a hobby making accessories. She started making accessories at home and selling them to friends and customers from the beauty salon. Now Sanaa has applied for this loan to buy more beads and some gemstones to make a new collection of accessories.

loans.use: to buy more beads and some gemstones

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 32 years old. She is a business lady who sells charcoal. She has been in business for five years. She is very hard working and humble. She describes her business as very busy and she has very loyal customers. She hopes to be a very successful business lady. She needs a loan of 20,857.50 KES to increase her stock of charcoal.

loans.use: to increase her stock of charcoal

loans.name: St Yowanina Group

texts.en: Teddy is a 56-year-old widow with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. Twenty years ago, she decided to venture into the retail business after her husband died. With the proceeds, she has been able to pay school fees for her children and buy land for farming. Like most traders, she faces a challenge of price fluctuation and high rental fees that limit her profits. Her goals are to educate her children and open an outlet in a nearby trading center. Teddy intends to use the loan to buy soap, sugar, maize, cassava flour and basins to sell. Only four of her group members applied for a loan but per group policy, all of them had to guarantee each other to access credit.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, maize, cassava flour and basins to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is from Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 63 years old. Norma is married and has three children. To make a living, Norma raises livestock for sale. Norma been in her business for 12 years and earns 8,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Norma joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner. Norma is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken, fresh vegetables, sodas, corn, and oil.

loans.name: Martir

texts.es:
Mártir, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, porque considera que los anteriores le han ayudarlo a mejorar su ganadería, él invertirá este préstamo en la compra de concentrado para el ganado, zacate molido, vitaminas y desparasitantes.
Él  manifiesta que el negocio de la ganadería y la agricultura ha mejorado, anteriormente logro realizar la siembra de granos basicos, tiene más oportunidades de obtener ingresos, las condiciones de vida con su esposa está cambiando positivamente.
texts.en:
Mártir has decided to take out another loan because he believes the previous ones have helped him to improve his cattle.  He will invest this loan in buying feed for the cattle, ground fodder, vitamins and deworming medicine.

He has shown that his cattle and agriculture business has improved.  Previously he would sow basic grains.  He now has more opportunities to bring in an income and living conditions for him and his wife are changing for the better.

loans.use: to buy ground fodder, vitamins and deworming medicine.

loans.name: Cinthya

texts.es:
Cinthya, de 19 años, es una mujer muy creativa, humilde y muy trabajadora, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres juntos a sus hermanos. 
El trabajo de Conthya consiste en la venta de prendas de vestir, ella misma se encarga de viajar mensualmente a otra ciudad para comprar las prendas al por mayor seleccionando una a una la ropa de mejor calidad con diseños modernos y de las mejores marcas, toda su mercadería suele distribuirlas a la venta de manera personal entre todos sus amigos, vecinos y personas conocidas a precios cómodos y por lo general lo realiza en poco tiempo, el plazo para el pago por las prendas lo coordina con sus clientes brindando siempre las comodidades necesarias y el tiempo prudente para continuar comprando nuevas prendas. Lleva en éste trabajo 2 años y le va bien. Por las mañanas trabaja desarrollando su carrera profesional en un estudio contable de la ciudad. Eventualmente también se dedica a la animación en fiestas infantiles.

Le gusta mucho sus dos trabajos ya que en ambos puede poner en práctica su don innegable de relacionarse con las personas y de desarrollar su creatividad y buen gusto en las cosas que ofrece, espera poder concretar su sueño de tener su propia tienda de ropas y continuar en su proceso de desarrollo económico. Este es el crédito número 1 con MFP, está muy feliz de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, asimismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que ha observado que todos sus integrantes son personas muy responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 500), comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería conformada por prendas de vestir principalmente para damas, asimismo se abastecerá de algunos artículos que usa en su trabajo decorativo.
texts.en:
Cinthya is 19 years old. She is a very creative, humble, and hard-working woman. She is single and does not have any children. She lives at home with her parents and her siblings. 

Cinthya's work consists of selling garments. This means she has to travel every month to another city in order to buy the garments wholesale. She selects the best quality clothes with modern designs and the best brands. She generally sells all her merchandise personally to her friends, neighbours, and acquaintances at affordable prices shortly after buying them. She coordinates the payment period for the garments with her customers, offering the necessary conveniences and time so they can continue buying new garments. She has been doing this for two years and it is going well. In the mornings she works - developing her professional career in one of the city's accounting firms. Occasionally she does entertaining at children's parties.

She likes both of her jobs because she can put her undeniable gift of relating to other people into practice, and she can develop her creativity and good taste. She hopes to be able to make her dream of having her own clothing store and continuing to grow financially a reality. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is very happy to know she has financial support, as it makes her feel more secure about advancing with her work. Therefore, she is committed to making her payments on time. She is also very happy to belong to her communal bank since she has observed that all of its members are responsible and supportive people.

With the amount requested, she will buy a greater quantity of merchansdise, the bulk of which will be women's garments. She will also supply herself with some articles that she uses in her decorative work.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, the bulk of which will be women's garments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a manicure and pedicure table.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 23 years old and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a bachelor. He collected money to buy a taxi but it is not enough. He intends to drive it himself to gain daily income. He applied for a youth loan of 250,000 YER from AMB to buy a taxi.

loans.use: to buy a taxi for transportation.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Ms Khalida has been running a business selling milk. She is an active lady, and makes enough to contribute to the family income.  Her husband is also working, but his income alone is not sufficient to bear the expenses of the family members. 

She is the mother of one child, and she lives in a large conventional family with her husband, child, and other relatives.  

She has requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 from Kashf Foundation.  She will be using this loan, along with her past savings, to buy one more cow to increase her sales; she expects to increase her business income. 

Khalida intends to use the profits to provide a good, quality education for her daughter, to give her a bright future.

loans.use: to buy one more cow to increase sales of her milk products.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 24 years old and married. Hasan lives with his parents, who assist him with the income. Hasan owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2010 and now he has an employee. He has gained good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a youth loan of $1,800 to install a rolling shutter for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter for his shop

loans.name: Kunda Yehova Group

texts.fr:
Françoise fait partie du groupe Kunda Yahova et habite à  Bujumbura. Elle  a  42 ans et est mariée à Pascal, un commerçant de sacs en plastique. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants, âgés de 14  à 20 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de sacs  en plastique depuis  10 ans. 

Elle est à son treizième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de sacs  en plastique à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  que ses enfants étudient et que chacun ait une parcelle construite.
texts.en:
Françoise belongs to the Kunda Yahova group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 42 years old and married to Pascal, who buys and sells plastic bags. They have three children together, ranging from 14 to 20 years of age.

She has been selling plastic bags for the past ten years and is on her 13th loan from Turame. With her KIVA loan she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of plastic bags so that she can earn more money.

In the coming years she would like her children to study and to each have a built-on piece of land.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of plastic bags to resell and make more money.

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
Jeralyn is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of seven young children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in the rice-farming business, together with her husband, for several years now. This is the source of their income.

Jeralyn is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the plants. With this, she and her husband will be able to grow and produce a good harvest, thus increasing their yield and income.

In the future, she dreams of expanding their business and saving money for the continuous schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the plants.

loans.name: Shalom: Dios Con Nosotros Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Shalom” que conforman 08 mujeres emprendedoras que pasan al ciclo 18.María tiene 44 años, casada con 03 hijos en la cual 01 de ellos en etapa escolar. María cuenta en su domicilio con una bodega de primera necesidad lleva trabajando hace mas de 5 años. María ha solicitado el préstamo para la compra de azúcar, leche, paneton, chocolate. Su sueño es de ampliar más su negocio. María agradece a Kiva y Edaprospo por permitirle seguir creciendo. María se encuentra ubicada en la parte de atrás es la segunda del lado derecho, viste polo manga larga negro y chaleco rojo.
texts.en: This is the “Shalom” group that is made up of 8 enterprising women in their 18th cycle. María is 44. She is married and has 3 children, one of whom is school aged. María has a basic necessities store in her house where she has worked for more than 5 years. María has asked for the loan to buy sugar, milk, paneton,and chocolate. Her dream is to expand her business more. María is grateful to Kiva and Edaprospo for allowing her to grow. María is in the back row on the right. She is wearing a long sleeve black short and a red vest.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, paneton, and chocolate.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 33, is married and has been blessed with two children. He used his previous loan to buy manure and pressure pipes. His business did very well and he successfully repaid his loan.  He has been farming for the last seven years. He also owns a green grocery. He is diligent and very hardworking. He has learnt how to budget the money that he gets from his business. 

He hopes to be a successful businessman and hopes to open a cereal store.

loans.use: to buy a water pump and tomato .

loans.name: Jones

texts.en: Jones,44, is a married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop for eight years, working six days a week and twelve hours a day. His business is located in the market, and thus attracts many customers. He also earns a salary as lab technician. Stiff competition is his great challenge and his dreams are to diversify his business to trade in unique products of better quality and also upgrade in his academic qualifications. Jones intends to use the money from this loan to buy rice, sugar, cassava flour and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, cassava flour and beans to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single woman of forty years.She has two children. She does pig farming in Kangemi and has been in this business for three years now. She gets a monthly income of 50,000 KES.

This will be Jane's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy piglets to rear and make a new shelter for her pigs. In the future, she wants to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and make another shelter for them.

loans.name: El Jasmin Group

texts.es:
Doña Rebeca es otro de los integrantes del grupo Jazmin, ella tiene la edad de 45 años, solo estudio la primaria y esta casada con el señor Alfonso.

Ella platica que hace un poco mas de 15 años con el apoyo de su familia abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes la cual de los años a crecido poco a poco. Doña Rebeca dice que en su negocio siempre se vende ya que vende es de uso diario.

Su negocio esta ubicado en su hogar y platica que su tienda de abarrotes no solo le a dado la oportunidad de brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sino tambien ayudo a enseñarar a sus hijos que la vida se gana y solo se sale adelante trabajando juntos.

Ella invertira este credito en la compra de variedad de productos enlatados, aceite, jugos, frijol, sal, arroz, sopa, azucar, arina, dulces, refresco, chile, tomates y cebolla para resurtir su negocio.

A doña Rebeca le gustaria ver a futuro su negocio muy grande y surtido para brindar un mejor servicio a los clientes de su pueblo.

Este grupo envia un saludo afectuoso a las personas que haran posible su credito.

Los demas integrantes del grupo son:
Isaura-Venta de topper
Consuelo-Venta de pollo
Bernardina-venta de refresco
Paulina- venta de pollo
Lucia- venta de antojitos
Minerva-Venta de refrescos
Beatriz-venta de fertilizantes
Ingrid-venta de reposteria
Minerva Alicia-polleria
texts.en:
Rebeca is another member of the "Jazmin" group.  She is 45 years old and studied no further than primary school.  She is married to a man named Alfonso.

Rebeca tells us that a little over 15 years ago, she opened a small grocery store with the support of her family.  Over the years, the store has grown little by little and she says that products are always selling because she sells items that people need on a daily basis.

Her business is in her own home.  The grocery store has not just given her the chance to provide the family with a higher quality of life but it has also helped her to teach her children that you must work to earn a living and that you can only progress by working together.

Rebeca will use the loan to buy a variety of products such as tinned food, oil, juices, beans, salt, rice, soup, sugar, flour, candy, drinks, chillis, tomatoes and onions to stock up the store.

In the future, she would like to see her business become bigger and better stocked so as to provide a better service to the customers in her town.

The group sends greeting to those who have helped make their loan possible.

The other members of this group are:

Isaura - sells tupperware 
Consuelo - sells chicken
Bernardina - sells drinks
Paulina - sells chicken
Lucia - sells snacks
Minerva - sells drinks
Beatriz - sells fertilizers
Ingrid - sells pastries
Minerva Alicia - chicken restaurant.

loans.use: to buy various products such as tinned food, oil, juices, beans, salt, rice, soup, sugar, flour, candy, drinks, chillis, tomatoes and onions.

location.town: Tembladeras del castillo, Acatlan de Perez Figuero

loans.name: Carla

texts.es:
La Sra. Carla es una mujer valiente, ella tiene 44 años, vive junto a su esposo y tiene 4 hijos a los cuales ama con todo su corazón y lucha día a día para sacarlos adelante, Carla se define como una persona emprendedora , humilde y muy luchadora por alcanzar sus metas, hace todo por el amor a su familia. 
El crédito solicitado a FODEMI se lo invertirá en la adecuación de la tienda, en la compra de estanterías y vitrinas para la colocación y exhibición de los productos que existe en la tienda, además hace falta comprar algunos productos de consumo masivo los cuales no tiene y es muy solicitado por sus clientes. 
El sueño que Carla tiene es el tener su propio micro mercado, y una pequeña bodega de productos de primera necesidad para vender en su ciudad, y con estos ingresos poder comprarse una casa y darles una mejor vida a sus hijos a los cuales ama con su propia vida
texts.en:
Carla is a brave woman. She is 44 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children, whom she loves with all of her heart, and whom she fights day to day to get ahead. Carla is defined as an enterprising woman who is humble and who fights to achieve her goals. She does everything out of love for her family.
 
The loan she has asked FODEMI for will be invested in improving the store, buying shelves and display cases to place and display the products. She also needs to to buy some popular products that she doesn't have and that are much in demand by her customers.
 
Carla's dream is to have her own micro-market and a little store with basic necessity products to sell in her city. Also, to buy a house with this income and give her children a better life. She loves them with her own life.

loans.use: to improve her store and buy popular products she needs to sell in her store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 37 years old, married with one child.  He  is a farmer who grows vegetables.  He also owns rental houses, which he rents out to customers. He has been in business for 10 years.  

Through the help of Faulu Kenya, he has increased his farm yield and increased his rental houses. 

He requests a loan of 106,600 KES to buy stones, sand, and cement for building rental houses.

loans.use: to buy stones, sand, and cement to build rental houses.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 38-year-old conservative woman; her husband took her place in the photo, as she requested. 

Her husband works in the Ministry of Education while Rania looks after their 3 boys and a girl. To support the family and fill her free time while the kids are at school, Rania established a small food and snacks market at her house, where most of the children come to buy their candy and snacks, and housewives get some basic food products. 

Rania has applied for this loan to buy some missing food products that were requested by some of her customers.

loans.use: to buy some missing food products requested by her customers for her small home market.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a 56-years-old married woman and a mother of four grown up children from Ubay, Bohol. She has run a sari sari store, or variety store, business for several years now. She is also engaged in the rice farming business together with her husband. These are the source of their income.

Julita needs a loan. She is asking for  a loan to buy fertlizer for the farm and additional inventory to sell like canned goods, noodles, chips and snack foods, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of their farm and the sales of her store thus augmenting their profits and income. 

In the future, Julita hopes to expand their business and makes it sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertlizer for the farm and additional inventory to sell like canned goods, noodles, chips and snack foods, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.es:
Jennifer, de 24 años de edad, es una joven mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, convive hace dos años con Anthony de 30 años, aún no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus suegros en compañía de sus cuñados.
La actividad que realiza Jennifer es la venta de comidas como desayunos, menús y otros. Estableció su negocio en un espacio de la casa de su cuñada. Atiende principalmente por las mañanas, pero en ocasiones lo hace también por las noches. Sus clientes son transeúntes de la zona, vecinos y amistades, por fortuna su establecimiento tiene buena acogida gracias a la buena sazón de sus comidas. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 2 años, emprendió esta aventura con ayuda de su cuñada gracias a un crédito financiero que obtuvieron, ahora trabajan juntas atendiendo siempre de manera cordial.
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual solventa los gastos de su hogar, pues ha tenido muchas necesidades económicas por los bajos ingresos cuando su esposo trabajaba de cocinero en un restaurante particular, pero ahora se siente más aliviada por desarrollar en su propia casa un oficio que le sirve de mucho. Este es el crédito número 5 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este financiamiento ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de forma puntual, del mismo modo se siente muy tranquila y respaldada por los integrantes de su banco comunal.
Con el monto solicitado de 500 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de víveres e ingredientes para la preparación de comidas.
texts.en:
Jennifer is 24 years old. She is a young, enterprising and hardworking woman. She has lived for two years with Anthony, who is 30. They still don't have children. She lives in her parents-in-law's house with her siblings-in-law. 

Jennifer sells meals such as breakfasts, lunches and more. She established her business in a space in her sister-in-law's house. She works mainly in the morning, but sometimes she works nights as well. Her customers are people passing through the area, neighbors and friends. Fortunately, her establishment is popular thanks to her good cooking. She has had her business for close to 2 years. She started this adventure with her sister-in -law's help, thanks to a loan they obtained. Now they work together, always serving in a friendly manner.

She likes the business because it allows her to have some income to pay for the household expenses. She has had a lot of financial needs because of the low income when her husband worked as a cook in a private restaurant. But right now she feels relieved because she has been developing her trade in her own house and it has been very useful. This is her 5th loan with MFP. She is grateful to those who have made access to this loan possible. This way, she will feel more confident advancing at her job. She is also committed to making her payments on time. She also feels very calm and supported by the members of her communal bank.

With the amount she has asked for, 500 nuevos soles, she will invest in buying produce and ingredients to prepare food.

loans.use: to buy produce and ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is fifty years old, married with four children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling clothes for five years. He is a builder and also practices farming. Responsible father that he is, he dreams of seeing all his children graduate with degrees and get employed by reputable organizations.The ever changing customer prefrences coupled with inadequate capital hinders his business while his dream is to own a modern boutique. Johnson intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Frasiah

texts.en:
Frasiah is 44 years old, married to Evans, and a mother of four children. She keeps and sells pigs in Kangemi. She has been in this business for two years now and gets a monthly income of sixty-thousand shillings.

This will be her first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the money to buy ten piglets to rear and sell later at a profit. In future she wants to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: to purchase ten piglets.

loans.name: Nathmiya

texts.en: Nathmiya is 48 years old and a married woman. Her husband is an electrician. She is a hair stylist working in a beauty salon. At home she runs a wedding gowns and evening dresses sales business. She has now applied for a loan to increase the number and model of dresses she has so she can add a dress rental option for those who ask for it.

loans.use: to increase the numbers and models of dresses.

loans.name: July

texts.es:
July, de 41 años de edad, es una mujer con muchos deseos de superación, además  de ser alegre, amable y muy trabajadora, es conviviente con Julio quien se dedica a la construcción civil, vive en su casa propia que adquirió como fruto de su trabajo continuo, lo habita en compañía de su pareja y sus dos hijos de 18 y 8 años de edad  que son su principal adoración y su motivo para esforzarse día a día por brindarles todo lo mejor.
La actividad laboral que realiza July, es la venta de bebidas heladas como gaseosas, cervezas y sabrosos helados de marcas reconocidas elaboradas de frutas tropicales, para eso cuenta con una congeladora en el que muestra las bebidas y una exhibidora para la venta de los helados dejada en consignación por la empresa distribuidora, ha establecido su negocio en un ambiente acondicionado en su propia casa, lleva dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 11 años atendiendo ella sola muy amablemente a todos sus clientes. Le gusta su trabajo pues le permite estar en casa para atender a sus hijos así como apoyar a su pareja con la economía de su hogar, viendo los buenos resultados que tiene y las ganancias que le genera su trabajo decidió continuar desarrollando este negocio, tiene planes de ampliarlo y abrir un bodega para la venta de abarrotes y otros productos. Este es el crédito número 17 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se siente mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, asimismo se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo, se siente cómoda trabajando con su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1000), comprará mayor cantidad de gaseosas, cervezas y helados para continuar vendiendo en su casa.
texts.en:
July, 41 years old, is a happy, friendly and hardworking woman with a strong desire to do well.  July lives in her own house. She bought this thanks to her continual hard work, and lives with her partner Julio, who works in construction, and her two children, who are 18 and eight years old.  Her children are her greatest loves and her motivation to put in so much effort every day, so that she can provide them with the best of everything.

July works selling cold drinks, like soda and beer and tasty ice-creams made with tropical fruits by a reputable brand.  For this, she has a freezer to display the drinks and a display case, provided by the distributor, for the ice-creams.  She runs her business out of a room in her house that has been set-up for this purpose and she has been doing this for 11 years.  Alone she serves her customers in a friendly manner.  She loves her job as it means she is at home to tend to her children and she can support her partner with the household bills.  Having seen the positive results she is having and the profits that her work is providing, July has decided to continue to develop the business.  She has plans to expand and to open a store selling groceries and other products.  This is her 17th loan with MFP and she is very happy to have financial support as she now feels more sure about moving forward in her work.  At the same time, she promises, once again, to repay her loan on time, as she has done previously.  She is comfortable working with the communal bank as all its members are responsible and supportive.  With the loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles, July with buy a larger quantity of sodas, beers and ice-creams to continue selling from her house.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of sodas, beers and ice-creams to continue selling from her house.

loans.name: Subhiya

texts.en:
Since Subhiya is a 60-year-old conservative woman, she asked her son, Osama, to appear in the photo instead. He also helps her in the business.

Subhiya started with a small food store in her house. However, now she has expanded her business by opening a small store that is separate from her  home. Now that all of her children have married, she has the time to concentrate on improving her business. Sometimes her son, Osama, comes by to help her and take her place so she can rest.  

Subhiya has now applied for this loan to buy new food products to increase her profits by having more variety in what she sells. She hopes in the future that she can expand her store to include selling home products and appliances.

loans.use: to buy new food products.

loans.name: Aiyda

texts.en:
Aiyda is a 42-year-old conservative woman; she has asked her husband to take her place in the photo. 

Aiyda is a mother of two sons and four daughters, her husband works as a bus driver in the airport. Aiyda on the other hand has a plant-selling business. She has a house plant nursery where she grows and keep small plants for sale. Now she has applied for a loan to bring in more winter plants for sale to increase her profits.

loans.use: to bring in more winter plants.

loans.name: Isaak

texts.en:
Isaak is a 24-year-old businessman who owns a grocery store. He has been in this business for the past seven years. He also sells cattle. He describes his business as very busy with many customers. He has managed to improve his living standards since he joined Faulu Kenya. 

Isaak hopes to have many customers and expand his business. He requires a loan of 20,857 KES to increase his stock of tomatoes, Irish potatoes, bananas and vegetables.

loans.use: to increase his stock of tomatoes, Irish potatoes, bananas and vegetables in his store.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

NWTF is relisting Susan's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 26-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda.

For eight years he has been operating a retail shop, and with the profits he was able to buy a motorcycle for a transport business.

Price fluctuation affects his business. His dream is to own a beer depot and expand his business into new areas despite the challenges of lack of enough capital and high transportation costs.

Samuel intends to use the loan to buy beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers to sell.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a 46-year-old poultry farmer who has been in business for 11 years. She is a widow and has three children. She also earns an income through renting houses. She was previously involved in farming. 

She is very hard-working and through Faulu Kenya she has learned how to save her money.

Someday she hopes to be the main supplier of eggs in her area and also to increase her rental houses. 

She wants a loan of 84,442.50 KES to buy chicken mash and chickens and to pay laborers.

loans.use: to buy chicken mash and chickens and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

NWTF is relisting Zosima's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба посвятила всю свою жизнь образованию и воспитанию молодежи своей Родины. Ей 51 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Более 30 лет она работает в средней школе и очень любит свою профессию. Местные жители очень уважают ее, так как она образованная и трудолюбивая женщина, а также высококвалифицированная  учительница.  Однако в течении многих лет, она не может улучшить условию проживания, так как ее зарплата маленькая и доход ее мужа тоже не позволяет купить все не обходимые средства для проживания. Она хочет организовать свой бизнес для получения дополнительного дохода. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес шитьем национального матраса «курпача», так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. «Курпача» это матрас, которое используется таджикским народом, как для спальни, так и для гостиной. Поэтому «курпача» имеет большой спрос. Махбуба будет шить «курпача» и продавать на местном рынке. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки ткани, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mahbuba has dedicated her life to the upbringing and education of her country's youth. Mahbuba is 51 years old, married, and raising 2 children. She has been working as a high school teacher for over 30 years and loves her job. The local populace respects Mahbuba as an educated and hard-working woman as well as a highly qualified educator. However, for a number of years, Mahbuba has been unable to improve her living conditions due to her and her husband's small salaries, which do not allow them to buy all necessities of life.

Mahbuba would like to start her own business in order to generate additional income. To this end, she took the course "Succeed", organized by the Association of Business Women, and obtained her graduation certificate. Now she is quite ready to set up her own business and become successful. Mahbuba would like to start making traditional "kurpacha" mattresses as she has experience in this craft. Kurpacha is a mattress used by Tajiks both in bedrooms and in living rooms, and so it is always in high demand. Mahbuba will sew kurpachas and sell them at the local market. She plans to use her additional income to improve her living conditions. She is requesting a loan of 6000 somoni to purchase fabrics for her new business. Mahbuba is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for launching her new business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 38, is a businesswoman who owns a retail shop. She has two children who are both in school. She has been in business for the last sixteen years. She also owns a van (matatu) that is used for public transport. She is very hardworking, and through the help of Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans and increase her stock.

She hopes to expand her shop. She requires a loan of 63,585 KES to buy kettles, buckets, cooking pots, cups, plates and basins.

loans.use: to buy kettles, buckets, cooking pots, cups, plates and basins.

loans.name: Analeah

texts.en:
Analeah is 34 years old and married. She has six children.

Analeah works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Analeah has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for eight years and also earns an income from buying and selling coconut.

Analeah aspires to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Bakereti

texts.en:
Bakereti is a 38-year-old married woman with seven children living in Kasese. After realizing that her husband alone could not provide optimally the family's basic needs, she decided to venture into cosmetic sales.

Just like most responsible mothers, she desires to educate her children up to the university. She also hopes to diversify her business to include clothes sales despite inadequate capital.

Bakereti is requesting a loan to buy body oil and women's wear to sell.

loans.use: to buy body oil and women's wear to sell.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Cresencia works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  

Cresencia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Cresencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Musisi

texts.en: Musisi is a 71-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a farmer, and with the proceeds from this business he has been able to pay school fees for his children and buy more land. He also earns additional income from his monthly pension. Diseases and unpredictable weather changes hinder his growth, while his dream is to venture into modern farming. His old house is on the verge of collapse, and he has started building a new house and is at window level. Musisi intends to use this loan to buy more construction materials like bricks and cement for his residential house.

loans.use: to construct a house.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old married guy, the father of one son. Mohammad has his own hot drinks kiosk, where he has been selling tea and coffee for the last three years. 

He now is applying for this youth loan to add selling different types of biscuits for sale, along coffee or tea.

loans.use: to add different type of biscuits to sell at his hot drinks kiosk.

loans.name: Rola

texts.en:
Rola is a 31-year-old married woman. She is a mother of three sons and two daughters. Her husband works in two jobs to be able to support the family.

Rola has a small home business selling clothes, blankets and other goods. She brings the goods from the wholesale market in other cities and sells them to friends and neighbors at a higher reasonable price. 

Now Rola has applied for this loan to buy a winter clothing collection.

loans.use: to buy a winter clothing collection.

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
Erlyn is 35 years old and married with 4 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Erlyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase pesticides and other farm equipment.

Erlyn has been farming rice for 15 years, and also earns additional income from buying & selling dried fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and other farm equipment for her rice farm.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a single woman of 38 years. She has no children but supports her mother. 

She sells used clothes and has been doing so for 13 years now. She gets a monthly income of 50,000 shillings.

This will be her sixth loan with KADET Ltd. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more stock of clothes for sale. In future, she wants to open a boutique.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 32-year-old divorced lady who sells food products like jams and sweets that she makes at home. 

She has applied for this loan in order to improve her business by bringing in more food products so she can make more profits that will allow her to open a food store.

loans.use: to buy more food products.

loans.name: Zorah

texts.en:
Zorah is 32 years, single, and blessed with one child, age 12. She runs a clothing shop in Kapsabet; she has been in operation for one year, earning a monthly income of KES. 8,000.  

She has requested a loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD. This is her third loan, and she intends to use it to purchase more new clothes for sale.  

The profits she earns will be plowed back into the business, which she hopes to expand.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is a 25-year-old single father living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been teaching for two years, working five days a week and eight hours a day in a private secondary school. He also practices farming to generate more income. His decision to join the education profession was due to his passion for nurturing young people. He has a business plan to become a model farmer in his village. Joel intends to use this loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en: Kholoud is a 25-year-old married lady. She is a mother of a daughter and a baby boy. Kholoud works as a farmer during the day, and in the evening she sells blankets at home. Now, she has applied for this loan to increase the quantity of blankets and bed covers so that she can increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and bed covers to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell in her vegetable vending business.

Irene has been in this business for 3 years; she earns more income from a general store, and farming rice.

Irene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Матлубе 25 лет. Она не замужем. Матлуба очень трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. Матлуба шьёт красивые национальные женские платья. Она имеет свою швейную машинку, но никогда не занималась бизнесом и не имела навыки и знания. Однако бурное развитие современно мира заставила ее решиться организовать свой бизнес.
С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес шитьем и продажей женской одежды. Она будет покупать ткань, шить платья и продавать на местном рынке. С бизнесом она будет заниматься одна, так как ее родители не могут помочь ей. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания, а также создать свой капитал. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки тканей, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Matluba is 25 years old and single. She is a very hard-working and kind woman. Matluba sews beautiful traditional women's dresses. While she has her own sewing machine, she never engaged in entrepreneurial activity and had no knowledge or skills in this area. However, the world's rapid development has made her take the decision to start her own business. To this end, Matluba took the course "Succeed", organized by the Association of Business Women, and received her graduation certificate. Now she is quite ready to launch her own business and succeed in this endeavour.

Matluba would like to focus her business on sewing and selling women's clothing. She will purchase fabrics, create dresses, and sell them at the local market. Matluba will run her business on her own as her parents are unable to help her. She plans to use her income to improve her living conditions and to accumulate some savings. She is requesting a loan of 4000 somoni to purchase fabrics for her new business. Matluba is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for starting her new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud, 21, is a single guy with an older married brother and a younger single sister. Mahmoud is a university student majoring in telecom engineering. He applied for this educational loan to pay his tuition for the next semester.

loans.use: to pay his tuition for the next semester.

loans.name: Jovelin

texts.en:
As a married parent of 2 children, Jovelin works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying & selling rice grains. 

Jovelin is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like can goods, noodles, soft drinks, etc. for her general store business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like can goods, noodles, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en: Hazem is a 24-year-old single guy who has 2 brothers and 3 younger sisters. Hazem has applied for this loan to pay for his next semester fees at the university. After getting his bachelor degree he wants to continue until he gets a masters degree, too, and for sure to work in his field.

loans.use: pay for his next semester fees.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of a grown up son from Ubay, Bohol. Marina has been engaged in a rice farming business together with her husband for almost 20 years now. This is the source of their income.

Marina is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to improve their farming business, thus augmenting their harvest, yield and profit. In the future, Marina dreams of expanding their business and making it a success. Moreover, she also plans on saving money for future use.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 49 years old and married with 6 children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 25 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional pesticides and other farm equipment. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional pesticides and other farm equipment.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is 27 years old and a carpenter in Bamburi, Mombasa. He is married and he supports three people in his family. He has been in this business for the last ten years and he is doing well. 

He is requesting his second loan after repaying the first one successfully. He will use the loan to purchase timber for his workshop and will use the anticipated profit to support his family as well as to expand his business. 

He hopes to have a prosperous life.

loans.use: to purchase timber for his workshop.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en: Titus is a thirty-two-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a teacher and has been in the profession for eight years. With his salary savings he has been able to set up a retail shop so as to meet the daily expenses since his salary is monthly. Price fluctuation and unfavorable working conditions are his greatest challenges, while his goal is to become self employed by starting a company and constructing a residential house. Titus intends to use the loan to buy construction materials such as poles and cement to sell.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as poles and cement to sell.

loans.name: Marlie

texts.en:
Marlie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like coffee, milk, sugar, noodles, can goods, etc. for her general store business.

Marlie has been in this business for three years. Marlie earns more income from buying and selling rice grains.

Marlie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money that she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like coffee, milk, sugar, noodles, can goods, etc.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is still managing a food stall, and she is still supporting her husband in the care of their three children.

She has now applied for her third loan after successfully repaying the previous loan. She plans to use the amount to purchase more stock of dry foods for her shop, including dry maize grains, beans, green grams (mung beans), wheat flour and millet flour. She hopes to use the profit she gets to expand her food kiosk and to repay her loan.

loans.use: To purchase dry food stock for her kiosk, including dry maize grains, beans, green grams (mung beans), wheat flour and millet flour.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 21 years old and a single guy majoring in Computer Science at a governmental university. He wants to graduate and start working in the field to get actual experience. Now he has applied for this loan to pay his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his next semester fees.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a twenty-six-year-old hardworking man living in Kasese, Uganda. He is an accountant and has been in service for three years. With his salary savings he has been able to buy a motorcycle for a transport business. He was inspired to go into the profession by his father and has since grown in his career. 

He now wants to start a retail shop in his home village after assessing the need and the available market. Evans intends to use the loan to buy stock such as rice and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock such as rice and soap to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a mother of one child aged 3 years. She is 32 years old and has been farming for ten years in her local home area in Central Kenya. Her farm produces cereals, mainly maize and beans for the local market.

Christine has requested a loan of 15,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chaff cutter to help ease the feeding of her dairy animals. She plans to expand her business and aspires to own a farm truck for supplying her produce as well as other farmers' produce at a fee to the local markets.

Christine notes lack of capital, costly feeds and poor development of local markets as her main challenges.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулноре 49 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Гулнора благодаря своим родителям получила высшее образование и уже много лет работает в средней школе своего района, учительницей. Ее зарплата не хватает на жизнь, а ее муж тоже не из тех, кто мог бы сам прокормить семью. С целью получения дополнительного дохода, Гулнора решила организовать свой бизнес. Она узнала от коллег о курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин, где обучают женщин организовать бизнес и как можно получать деньги для бизнеса. Она с огромным желанием  обучилась на этом курсе и получила сертификат. Она получила хорошие знания о бизнесе, и теперь она уверена в реализации своего плана. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей сухофруктов. Она собирается торговать на ближайшем местном рынке своего района. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки сухофруктов, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Этот займ поможет ей организовать бизнес и таким путем улучшить условию проживания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulnora is 49 years old, married, and raising 1 child. Thanks to her parents, Gulnora received university education, and for many years has been working as a teacher at her local high school. However, her salary is very low, and her husband is also unable to provide for their family on his own. In order to secure an additional source of income, Gulnora has decided to start her own business. She learned from her colleagues about the course "Succeed", organized by the Association of Business Women, where women are taught to set up their own businesses and earn a profit. With great enthusiasm, Gulnora took the course and received her graduation certificate. She learned good business skills and is now certain that her plan can be brought to life.

Gulnora would like to start her own business of buying and selling dried fruits. She is planning to do her trade at the nearest local market. Gulnora is requesting a loan of 5000 somoni to purchase dried fruits for her new business. This loan will help her improve her living conditions, and she is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits for starting her new business

loans.name: Kahindi

texts.en:
Kahindi is a 34-year-old charcoal dealer in Mombasa. He is married and a father to two children who are both school-going. He has been in this business for the last eight years and is doing great. 

This is his second loan after he repaid the previous loan successfully. He plans to use the loan to purchase more charcoal to stock for his business while the anticipated profits will be used to expand his business. 

He hopes to have a happy family in future.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to stock

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en: Najwa is an 18-year-old single lady; she is the youngest among her three siblings. Najwa is a university student majoring in Anthropology. She has applied for this loan to pay for her next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester fees.

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her bakery business.

Melly has been in this business for two years. Melly earns more income from her general store.

Melly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her bakery business

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 52-year-old widow. She is supporting herself and her two daughters from the income she makes out of selling used furniture. For the last few years, Khadija has been buying and selling used furniture from individuals and other shops. 

Now Khadija has applied for a loan to get more furniture to resell and to add some home appliances for sale too.

loans.use: to get more used furniture to resell.

loans.name: Union Pesquera Group

texts.es:
Yuliana es otro de los integrantes del grupo, ella solo estudio la secundaria y esta casada con el señor Juan alberto con el cual tiene 3 pequeños hijos.

Ella platica que se dedica a la venta de Mojarra ya que en la comunidad en la que vive hay una laguna y la principal fuente de empleo es la pesca y venta de Mojarra.

Yuliana realiza sus ventas de casa en casa en la comunidades cercanas. Ella se levanta todos los dias muy temprano a ir a comprar la mojarra a la orrilla de la laguna para despues salir a revenderla. Ella dice que el trabajo es duro pero le gusta porque ha conocido mucha gente y ademas gana su dinero con el cual ayuda a su esposo a dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Ella invertira este credito en la compra de mojarra para continuar realizando sus ventas.

Ella espera a futuro poder dar a sus hijos mas estudios y una mejor calidad de vida.

Los demas integrantes del grupo son:

Ines-Venta de pollo
Eusebia-Venta de pescado
Ofelia-Realiza costura
Esteban-venta de carne de puerco
texts.en:
Yuliana is another member of the communal bank.  She only has a high school education.  She is married to Juan Alberto, and they have three small children.  She says that she sells ‘Mojarra’  [small fry fish] because there is a lake in the community where she lives.  The principal source of employment in Mojarra is fishing and sales. 

Yuliana sells door to door in nearby communities.  She gets up very early every day to go and buy the mojarra on the side of the lake.  She later goes and resells the fish.  She says that the work is hard.  However, she likes it because she has met a lot of people and also because she earns money.  She uses the money to help her husband give their family a better quality of life.

She will use the loan to buy mojarra in order to continue with her sales.  In the future she hopes to be able to give her children more education and a better quality of life.

The other members of the group are:

Ines-Sells chicken
Eusebia-Sells fish
Ofelia-Sewing
Esteban-Sells pork

loans.use: to buy ‘Mojarra’  [small fry fish].

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 63 years old and married with four children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She earns a living by selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. In the future, Zosima would like to save enough money so she could continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa is 34 years old, married with three children. Two of her children are in school, and she is a very hard-working entrepreneur.
